job.title: SAP Data Migration Lead (34087)
job.description:
Myticas Consulting is actively seeking an experienced SAP Data Migration Lead for a high-impact, long-term contract with our client in the natural resources sector. This role is based in Vancouver, BC and follows a hybrid model with 20–30% travel.

The selected candidate will lead the data migration stream as part of an SAP S/4HANA and Ariba implementation. We’re looking for a hands-on leader who can architect, manage, and deliver high-quality data conversion solutions.

Responsibilities:

  • Lead the SAP S/4HANA and Ariba data migration stream

  • Manage data conversion activities across the full lifecycle: design, build, test, validation, cutover

  • Set up data migration technical architecture using Syniti ADMM

  • Provide technical direction to the data conversion team

  • Collaborate with functional teams to map and transform source data

  • Conduct data profiling, cleansing, and reconciliation

  • Develop and monitor data quality dashboards and pre/post-validation reports

Required Qualifications:

  • 5–10 years of SAP MDM/Data Migration experience

  • Minimum of 5 full-cycle SAP implementations

  • Expertise with Syniti ADMM (Advanced Data Migration and Management)
    (Candidates with BODS only will be considered after Syniti profiles)

  • Experience loading S/4HANA data using IDOCs, LTMC/LTMOM, LSMW, and custom methods

  • Strong hands-on experience in SQL and data analysis tools

  • Proven knowledge of SAP data objects and functional modules:

  • FI, CO (Record to Report)

  • MM, IM, EWM (Procure to Pay)

  • PM, QM, IBP, PS, HR

Preferred Experience:

  • Data migration project experience in the Energy or Natural Resources sector

  • Deep hands-on knowledge of Syniti ADMM tools:

  • Snapshot Management (data extraction)

  • Quality Module (profiling, dashboards)

  • Syniti Match, Construct, Migrate apps

  • Data migration cockpit and LTMOM

  • Data orchestration and CDC (Change Data Capture)

  • Security features (encryption, masking, user management)

job.title: Senior MS Dynamics 365 Solutions Architect (32301)
job.description:
Job Description: Microsoft Dynamics 365 Solutions Architect

Our client based in New Brunswick is looking for an experienced Microsoft Dynamics 365 Solutions Architect lead for a HYBRID model. The candidate will lead our client's Dynamics 365 initiatives. The ideal candidate has progressed through roles such as Functional Consultant to Solutions Architect, possesses broad sector experience, and excels in client-facing scenarios. This role requires managing various workstreams, including point of sales and finance, ensuring effective integration, and supporting business development with a comprehensive understanding of the overall strategy.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Lead the design and implementation of Microsoft Dynamics 365 solutions.
  • Engage with frontline stakeholders, demonstrating excellent communication skills.
  • Manage all workstreams involved in the project, ensuring effective integration.
  • Support business development with a comprehensive understanding of the big picture.

Ideal Candidate Profile:

  • Progressed through roles to become a Solutions Architect, ideally starting as a Functional Consultant.
  • Possesses broad sector experience.
  • Client-facing with excellent communication skills, able to engage with frontline stakeholders.
  • Capable of managing all workstreams involved in the project (e.g., point of sales, finance) and integrating them effectively.
  • Supports business development with a comprehensive understanding of the big picture.

Preferred Background:

  • Experience with Big 4 firms or other global professional services organizations.

job.title: SAP FICO/RTR Lead (32631)
job.description: <p>Myticas Consulting is seeking an experienced <strong>SAP FICO/RTR Lead</strong> for a long-term HYBRID contract with a major utility and energy client. This is a senior-level <strong>techo-functional</strong> role requiring a mix of <strong>deep functional finance expertise</strong> and <strong>strong technical capabilities</strong> within the SAP ecosystem. The position requires frequent travel (50–70%) to Winnipeg, MB, and the consultant may be based anywhere in Canada.</p> <p><strong>Project Scope:</strong><br> The successful candidate will help develop methodologies, tools, and thought leadership in SAP Finance as part of a critical ERP initiative. The role requires strong hands-on knowledge of <strong>SAP Finance (FICO/RTR)</strong> and integration with other modules, along with experience in <strong>end-to-end implementations</strong> and <strong>strategic financial processes</strong>.</p> <hr> <p><strong>Key Responsibilities:</strong></p> <ul> <li> <p>Lead SAP FICO/RTR workstream across implementation and integration efforts</p> <li> <p>Provide hands-on configuration and design of SAP Finance modules (GL, AP, AR, AA, CO, Treasury, SAC-Planning, etc.)</p> <li> <p>Collaborate with business and technical teams to document requirements, define process flows, and ensure high-quality solution delivery</p> <li> <p>Integrate SAP FICO with PS, PM, MM, IS-U, and SCM modules</p> <li> <p>Contribute to finance strategy, reporting systems, and regulatory requirements specific to utilities</p> </ul> <hr> <p><strong>Key Qualifications:</strong></p> <ul> <li> <p>8+ years of SAP Finance experience across GL, AR, AP, AA, CO, etc.</p> <li> <p>Experience leading large-scale SAP S/4HANA implementations</p> <li> <p>Functional and technical experience with finance and cost accounting processes</p> <li> <p>Strong familiarity with SAP integrations across IS-U, MM, CS, EWM, PS</p> <li> <p>Understanding of Power & Utilities finance regulations is a plus</p> <li> <p>SAP Certifications highly preferred</p> <li> <p>Degree in Accounting, Finance, or Computer Science (MBA a strong asset)</p> <li> <p>Experience with Datasphere, SAC, and Analysis for Office is a bonus</p> </ul> <hr> <p><strong>Additional Details:</strong></p> <ul> <li> <p>Travel to Winnipeg is mandatory (50–70%)</p> <li> <p>Must be flexible with on-site scheduling</p> <li> <p>This is a client-facing leadership role requiring excellent communication and stakeholder engagement skills</p> </ul>

job.title: Business Intelligence Business Objects SQL Developer (32539)
job.description: <p><strong>Business Intelligence (BI) Business Objects/SQL Developer </strong></p> <p><strong>Job Title:</strong> Business Intelligence (BI) Business Objects/SQL Developer</p> <p><strong>Location:</strong> Remote (with occasional travel to Springfield, IL)</p> <p><strong>Contract: </strong>12 months with possibly multiyear extension/s</p> <p><strong>Functional Description: </strong></p> <p>Clover Consulting (a Myticas Co.) is seeking a skilled and experienced BI BusinessObjects/SQL Developer to design, develop, and maintain business intelligence solutions using SAP BusinessObjects and SQL. This role supports Medicaid/CHIP claims and other healthcare data systems, ensuring accurate reporting and data integrity for state and federal stakeholders.</p> <p><strong>Key Responsibilities:</strong></p> <ul> <li>Design, develop, and maintain BusinessObjects reports using Medicaid/CHIP claims and subsystem data. <li>Write, optimize, and maintain complex SQL scripts and queries for data marts and reporting. <li>Create and manage BusinessObjects Universes and metadata layers. <li>Develop and maintain database systems to support efficient data storage and reporting. <li>Manage server backups and ensure system reliability. <li>Collaborate with stakeholders to gather requirements and recommend technical solutions. <li>Participate in unit, integration, and system testing. <li>Provide regular project updates to customers and maintain strong communication. <li>Mentor junior team members and provide technical training as needed. <li>Stay current with emerging technologies and industry best practices. <li>Perform additional duties as required to support project and organizational goals. </ul> <p><strong>Required Qualifications:</strong></p> <ul> <li>5+ years of experience in SAP BusinessObjects development and reporting including report Universe designing. <li>5+ years of SQL development, including 4+ years of performance tuning. <li>2+ years of experience in data warehouse projects. <li>2+ years of experience with Teradata (v15+), including SQL Assistant. <li>Strong communication skills and the ability to work directly with clients. <li>Bachelor’s or advanced degree in IT, Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, or a related field. <li>Excellent organizational skills and ability to manage multiple priorities. <li>Strong team collaboration and adaptability. </ul> <p><strong>Preferred Qualifications: </strong></p> <ul> <li>2+ years of experience as Business Objects server administrator <li>Familiarity with Medicaid, Medicare, or healthcare-related applications. <li>Experience with Tableau or BusinessObjects version upgrades. 2025 Business Intelligence (BI) Business Objects/S </ul>

job.title: Senior IT Project Manager (32567)
job.description: <span style="font-size: 12.0pt;"><span style="font-family: Aptos , sans-serif;"><strong>Senior Project Manager (Contract)</strong></span></span><br> <br> <br> <span style="font-size: 12.0pt;"><span style="font-family: Aptos , sans-serif;"><strong>Overview:</strong><br> <br> We are seeking an experienced Senior Project Manager to support the execution of multiple strategic initiatives within our client’s organization. This role is critical in ensuring the successful delivery of projects in alignment with business objectives, IT leadership direction, and established PMO frameworks.</span></span><br> <br> <br> <span style="font-size: 12.0pt;"><span style="font-family: Aptos , sans-serif;"><strong>Key Responsibilities:</strong></span></span><br> <br> <br> <span style="font-size: 12.0pt;"><span style="font-family: Aptos , sans-serif;">As a Senior PM, you will work closely with business and technical stakeholders to steer initiatives from planning through to implementation, ensuring delivery is on time, within scope, and on budget. Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:</span></span><br> <ul> <li style="margin-top: 0.0cm;margin-bottom: 0.0cm;"><strong>Project Planning & Scope Management:</strong><br> Define project scope and objectives in collaboration with sponsors and stakeholders. Develop detailed project schedules and comprehensive plans covering scope, timeline, budget, risk, change, communication, and quality management. <li style="margin-top: 0.0cm;margin-bottom: 0.0cm;"><strong>Execution & Oversight:</strong><br> Monitor project progress, manage cross-functional resources, and lead project execution according to established goals. Ensure effective team collaboration and resource alignment across all phases. <li style="margin-top: 0.0cm;margin-bottom: 0.0cm;"><strong>Risk & Issue Management:</strong><br> Identify, assess, and manage project risks and critical path dependencies. Escalate and resolve issues while maintaining transparency and governance. <li style="margin-top: 0.0cm;margin-bottom: 0.0cm;"><strong>Stakeholder Engagement & Reporting:</strong><br> Prepare and deliver executive-level updates, dashboards, and steering presentations. Facilitate workshops and status meetings; ensure stakeholder expectations are managed effectively throughout the project lifecycle. <li style="margin-top: 0.0cm;margin-bottom: 0.0cm;"><strong>Change Management Integration:</strong><br> Align with change management strategies to support adoption and ensure smooth transition of initiatives. Track implementation and address any business readiness concerns. <li style="margin-top: 0.0cm;margin-bottom: 0.0cm;"><strong>Governance & Quality Control:</strong><br> Ensure adherence to organizational PMO standards and best practices. Support continuous improvement efforts and implement lessons learned. <li style="margin-top: 0.0cm;margin-bottom: 0.0cm;"><strong>Business Case Support:</strong><br> Partner with business units and analysts to develop compelling business cases for project investment and benefits realization. </ul> <br> <br> <span style="font-size: 12.0pt;"><span style="font-family: Aptos , sans-serif;"><strong>Qualifications & Skills:</strong></span></span><br> <br> <span style="font-size: 12.0pt;"><span style="font-family: Aptos , sans-serif;">We’re looking for candidates who bring both strategic foresight and executional discipline, with the following profile:</span></span><br> <ul> <li style="margin-top: 0.0cm;margin-bottom: 0.0cm;">Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Business, IT Management, or a related discipline. <li style="margin-top: 0.0cm;margin-bottom: 0.0cm;">PMP certification (or equivalent experience) is required. <li style="margin-top: 0.0cm;margin-bottom: 0.0cm;">8–10 years of project management experience, with at least 5 years managing large-scale initiatives. <li style="margin-top: 0.0cm;margin-bottom: 0.0cm;">Proficient in project planning tools and methodologies. <li style="margin-top: 0.0cm;margin-bottom: 0.0cm;">Adept at managing matrixed teams and external vendors. <li style="margin-top: 0.0cm;margin-bottom: 0.0cm;">Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills. <li style="margin-top: 0.0cm;margin-bottom: 0.0cm;">Strong problem-solving capabilities and ability to navigate ambiguity. <li style="margin-top: 0.0cm;margin-bottom: 0.0cm;">Demonstrated ability to juggle multiple priorities while maintaining a focus on delivery and results. </ul>

job.title: RF Systems Engineer (32648)
job.description: As a RF Systems Engineer, you’ll be responsible for simulating and modeling the terrestrial and in-orbit communication systems for Lightspeed and support the definition of the architecture. <h2>Main Responsibilities</h2> <ul> <li>Simulate and model communication systems <li>Work with system architects, RF engineers, antenna engineers, User Terminal and Landing Station engineers, to partition functions between hardware and software domains <li>Model RF link performance and manage link budgets accounting for impairments through the different elements in the system <li>Derive specifications for RF links and RF and antenna subsystems <li>Characterize and analyze system performance. Develop and maintain performance budgets <li>Provide technical support to regulatory, coordination, and market access teams </ul> <h2>Education & Experience Required</h2> <ul> <li>Bachelor&apos;s degree in electrical engineering with emphasis in RF/microwave circuits or communication theory <li>At least 5 years of relevant experience RF communication systems <li>Knowledge of digital communication systems, spread spectrum, single and multi-carrier techniques, modulation types such as PSK, APSK, QAM <li>Specific experience with modulation standard such as DVB-S2X and DVB-RCS2, as well as with Adaptive Coding and Modulation (ACM) methods <li>Good experience in MATLAB or other tools for modeling and analyzing RF communication systems </ul> <h2>Specialized Knowledge, Skills & Abilities</h2> <ul> <li>Experience performing analysis and simulation of communication systems <li>Thorough understanding of RF passive and active components <li>Good understanding of active antenna beam forming technologies including digital beam forming, and fast beam hopping <li>Experience characterizing radio performance at microwave frequencies, including rain fade and its effects on the communication links <li>Knowledge of RF transceiver architectures and digital communication theor </ul>

job.title: DevOps Technical Analyst (32638)
job.description: <p>Myticas Consulting is seeking a self-motivated <strong>Technical Analyst</strong> to support a long-term engagement with our non for profit client. This is a two-year contract opportunity ideal for a DevOps-savvy analyst with a strong foundation in system analysis and cloud/infrastructure operations. The ideal candidate will thrive in a collaborative environment, have a passion for automation and modern DevOps practices, and be eager to take ownership in a hands-on technical role.</p> <p><strong>Responsibilities:</strong></p> <ul> <li> <p>Manage, maintain, and enhance cloud and on-premise environments</p> <li> <p>Implement and optimize CI/CD pipelines</p> <li> <p>Conduct system and integration analysis to ensure high performance and availability</p> <li> <p>Collaborate with development and infrastructure teams to support environment configuration and deployment</p> <li> <p>Leverage monitoring tools to identify and resolve technical issues proactively</p> <li> <p>Mentor junior team members and contribute to best practices documentation</p> </ul> <p><strong>Qualifications:</strong></p> <p><strong>Education:</strong></p> <ul> <li> <p>Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or a related field</p> <li> <p>Certifications such as AWS, ITIL, or similar are an asset</p> </ul> <p><strong>Experience:</strong></p> <ul> <li> <p>5+ years in system analysis, environment management, or software engineering</p> <li> <p>Experience with cloud platforms and managing hybrid infrastructure</p> <li> <p>Hands-on with DevOps tools and CI/CD processes</p> </ul> <p><strong>Technical Skills:</strong></p> <ul> <li> <p>Proficient in APIs, RESTful services, and system integration</p> <li> <p>Skilled in containerization (Docker, Kubernetes)</p> <li> <p>Experience with version control tools (Git)</p> <li> <p>Scripting capabilities (Python, Bash)</p> <li> <p>Familiarity with monitoring and automation frameworks</p> </ul> <p><strong>Soft Skills:</strong></p> <ul> <li> <p>Excellent analytical and communication skills</p> <li> <p>Leadership qualities and ability to mentor others</p> <li> <p>Self-starter mindset with strong organizational abilities</p> </ul>

designing and bringing to production high-speed analog/mixed-signal IPs in deep submicron CMOS (e.g., high-speed ADCs, DACs, low-jitter PLLs).</span> <li style="margin-right: 0.0in;"><span style="font-size: 12.0pt;">In-depth understanding of analog circuit methodologies, layout effects, and device physics.</span> <li style="margin-right: 0.0in;"><span style="font-size: 12.0pt;">Experience with behavioral modeling (Verilog-A/AMS).</span> <li style="margin-right: 0.0in;"><span style="font-size: 12.0pt;">Ability to work collaboratively with distributed design teams.</span> <li style="margin-right: 0.0in;"><span style="font-size: 12.0pt;">Strong problem-solving skills, attention to detail, and effective communication.</span> <li style="margin-right: 0.0in;"><span style="font-size: 12.0pt;">Experience with Matlab and/or optical communication theory is a plus.</span> </ul> <span style="font-size: 12.0pt;"><strong>Education & Experience:</strong></span> <ul> <li style="margin-right: 0.0in;"><span style="font-size: 12.0pt;">M.S. in Electrical Engineering with 12+ years of experience, or</span> <li style="margin-right: 0.0in;"><span style="font-size: 12.0pt;">Ph.D. in Electrical Engineering with 8+ years of experience.</span> </ul> <span style="font-size: 12.0pt;"><strong>Location:</strong><br> Hybrid – United job.title: Lab Technician (32645)
job.description: <p>Myticas direct client is seeking<strong> Jr Lab Technician</strong> at Waukegan, IL <strong>(Hybrid-3 days onsite)</strong><br> <br> <strong>Duration: 6</strong><strong> months</strong><strong> (with a possibility of extension)</strong><br> <br> <strong>Description:</strong><br> <br> One of our direct clients is looking for a Jr Lab Technician who would be responsible for performing highly automated compound management department utilizing robotic instruments to manage the tasks of adding or removing samples from storage banks, along with electronic barcodes to facilitate record-keeping and sample preparation tailored to research scientists’ experimental needs. Automation not only accelerates sample delivery but also promises enhanced consistency of samples regarding concentration accuracy and the uniformity of physical properties across experimental runs. These improvements are crucial in advancing early drug discovery.<br> <br> Responsibilities:<br> <br> Work cross-functionally to develop a deep understanding of the scientific processes and identify key bottlenecks that could be improved with automation to increase research velocity.<br> • Develop appropriate automation protocols to meet the needs research scientists.<br> • Maintain instrumentation through routine maintenance and Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) to minimize equipment downtime.<br> • Write and update protocols for new automation workflows using robotic-specific software for laboratory instruments, e.g., Tecan, Beckman Coulter, Agilent Technologies, and SPT.<br> • Draft, edit, and review laboratory Standard Operating Procedures for the automated platforms and the protocols necessary to support sample delivery.<br> • Promptly enter all data to support the needs of the research scientist.<br> • Interpret results, identify anomalies or unexpected outcomes, and provide appropriate remedies.<br> <br> Qualifications:<br> List required and preferred qualifications (up to 10). Include education, skills, and experience.<br> • Bachelor’s degree in a scientific discipline (e.g., biology, chemistry, or similar).<br> • Experience with robotic liquid handlers from Hamilton, TECAN, Agilent Technologies, or Beckman Coulter.<br> • Experience in compound management preferred.<br> • Ability to work upright and stationary and/or standing for typical working hours.<br> • Ability to lift and move objects up to 25 pounds.<br> • Ability to work in non-traditional work environments.<br> • Ability to use and learn standard office equipment and technology proficiently.<br> • May have exposure to potentially hazardous elements typically found in laboratory environments (PPE required).</p>

job.title: ASIC Development Engineer (32477)
job.description: <p><strong>Position: Senior ASIC Design Engineer – Optical Communication Systems</strong></p> <p>Our client’s team is expanding and seeking highly motivated, experienced professional engineers to help develop next-generation systems in a rapidly growing and competitive industry. This is an excellent opportunity to contribute to cutting-edge technologies in optical communication. Candidates must hold a degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, Computer Science, or possess equivalent professional experience.</p> <p><strong>Key Responsibilities:</strong></p> <ul> <li>Develop state-of-the-art electronic devices and intellectual property (IP) for optical communication systems. <li>Apply proven expertise in deep sub-micron silicon technologies. <li>Collaborate effectively within a multi-site, international development team. <li>Design ASIC devices for the processing of optical signals. </ul> <p><strong>Required Qualifications and Skills:</strong></p> <ul> <li>Master’s degree or PhD in Electronic Engineering, Telecommunication Engineering, or a related discipline. <li>A minimum of 8 years of demonstrated experience in deep sub-micron ASIC design. <li>Proficiency in VHDL and/or Verilog for development and ASIC verification. <li>Preferred experience in digital signal processing (DSP) and forward error correction (FEC) design. <li>Experience with high-speed analog design is a plus. <li>Strong analytical thinking and problem-solving capabilities. <li>Excellent teamwork skills, with the ability to collaborate across international teams and time zones. <li>Effective communication skills, including fluency in English. </ul>

job.title: Optical Resident Engineer (32419)
job.description: <p><strong>Job Title: Optical Resident Engineer</strong><br> <strong>Primary Location: Charlotte, NC</strong><br> <em>Other Considered Locations: Columbus, OH; Tampa, FL; Austin, TX; Cerritos, CA</em><br> <em>Note: Please indicate your desired work location at the top of your resume upon submission.</em></p> <h3><strong>Job Summary</strong></h3> <p>We are seeking an experienced <strong>Optical Resident Engineer</strong> to work on-site at a customer location. While Charlotte, NC is the preferred location, candidates located near Columbus, OH; Tampa, FL; Austin, TX; or Cerritos, CA will also be considered. Periodic travel to Dallas, TX will be required. All business travel must receive prior written managerial approval, which must accompany receipt submissions via Fieldglass.</p> <h3><strong>Key Requirements</strong></h3> <p>Candidates <strong>must</strong> meet the following requirements, be able to clearly discuss relevant experience during a technical interview, and ensure such experience is reflected in the resume:</p> <ul> <li>10+ years of experience with a telecom equipment vendor or service provider, specifically configuring, monitoring, and troubleshooting Long Haul (LH) and Metro Optical DWDM networks. <li>7+ years of hands-on experience using optical design tools for generating design packages, managing optical power budgets, and applying knowledge of various amplifier types. <li>7+ years of experience with optical network management systems, particularly <strong>NFM-T</strong>. <li>Experience in IP networking. <li>Practical experience with the implementation of <strong>GMPLS</strong> and <strong>CDC</strong> technologies in DWDM networks is preferred. <li>Product knowledge preferred: <strong>1830 PSS, 1350 OMS (WS-NOC), EPT, and CPB tools</strong>. <li>Strong verbal and written communication skills with clients. </ul> <h3><strong>Role Responsibilities</strong></h3> <p>The Optical Resident Engineer will serve in a consultative capacity, working closely with customers and internal teams across network strategy, design, implementation, and support activities. Key responsibilities include:</p> <ul> <li>Developing network architectures and service designs aligned with customer requirements and industry best practices. <li>Producing network implementation and migration plans. <li>Configuring optical equipment and services. <li>Supporting and testing networks during all stages of deployment. <li>Conducting audits and assessments to ensure network compliance with customer expectations. <li>Formulating and implementing network management strategies. <li>Preparing and reviewing technical statements of work. <li>Creating and delivering customer training materials. <li>Evaluating network performance, scalability, manageability, and security. <li>Recommending strategies for network performance optimization. <li>Collaborating with internal teams to drive product enhancements. <li>Conducting network and customer readiness testing. <li>Building and maintaining strong relationships with both technical and management stakeholders. <li>Supporting critical network events during scheduled maintenance windows, which may require work during off-hours. </ul> <h3><strong>Qualifications</strong></h3> <p><strong>Education:</strong></p> <ul> <li> <p>Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or a related field; equivalent work experience will also be considered.</p> </ul> <p><strong>Experience:</strong></p> <ul> <li>10+ years of hands-on experience in optical DWDM network engineering. <li>7+ years of experience in optical design and network management. <li>Familiarity with 1830 PSS, 1350 OMS, EPT, and CPB tools. <li>Experience with GMPLS and CDC technologies is a plus. <li>Proven ability to communicate complex technical information to clients effectively. </ul>

job.title: Senior FPGA Developer (32589)
job.description: <p><strong>Overview & Role Focus</strong></p> <p>This role is centered on innovating and advancing state-of-the-art video processing and transport capabilities, delivering high-performance solutions on some of the most integrated poadcast hardware platforms available today. The successful candidate will work hands-on with FPGA design, real-time media interfaces, and poadcast protocol implementation, playing a key role across architecture, development, testing, and cross-functional support.</p> <p><strong>Key Responsibilities</strong></p> <ul> <li>Lead the development and continuous improvement of advanced video transport and processing features within tightly integrated poadcast hardware. <li>Design RTL for real-time, high-throughput media systems involving advanced interfaces—such as PCIe, memory, and specialized hardware acceleration (e.g., video scaling, HDR/SDR conversion). <li>Implement FPGA-based real-time transport protocols like SMPTE 2110 and SDI. <li>Participate in architectural planning: advise on FPGA density, schematic reviews, clocking strategies, and thermal considerations. <li>Build complete IO ring designs across modern FPGAs (Arria10, Stratix-10, Ultrascale+, MPSoC, Agilex) and validate pin-outs/IP within Quartus and Vivado environments. <li>Define and negotiate high-level design specs, assist in part selection, and align with aggressive project timelines. <li>Contribute to design specifications and documentation used by cross-functional teams. <li>Collaborate closely with peers on design verification and testing of FPGA and hardware systems. <li>Tackle debugging with a methodical and efficient approach. <li>Support team members throughout the entire New Product Introduction (NPI) lifecycle—from design through manufacturing to customer support. </ul> <p><strong>Required Skills & Background</strong></p> <ul> <li>5+ years in FPGA and hardware development, with a strong preference for experience in video/audio-centric technologies. <li>Intermediate to senior-level expertise in FPGA architecture and core components. <li>Deep understanding of high-speed serial interfaces, clock domains, timing closure, and transceiver integration. <li>Proficiency in Verilog, SystemVerilog, and TCL scripting; capable of creating testbenches and running simulations (e.g., VCS). <li>Familiarity with modern Intel and Xilinx FPGA families and their development/debugging toolchains. <li>Hands-on experience with interfaces like DDR3/DDR4, HBM, PLLs, and gigabit transceivers. <li>Skilled in lab-based debugging using oscilloscopes, JBERTs, network analyzers, waveform monitors, etc. <li>Embedded system awareness—experience with Linux, C/C++, bash scripting, and networking considered valuable. <li>Broadcast studio domain knowledge is highly desirable, especially within video production and distribution workflows. <li>A strong grasp of digital video/audio standards and signal integrity is considered a plus. <li>Driven and independent, yet collaborative—equally adept at working solo or influencing poader team strategies. <li>Quick learner with a creative mindset and ability to push ideas from concept to market. <li>Comfortable making bold decisions that balance quality, speed, and cost for optimal business outcomes. <li>Effective communicator with sharp observational skills and a problem-solving mindset. </ul>

In this hybrid U.S.-based role, you&apos;ll collaborate closely with circuit designers to ensure optimal layout quality, performance, and delivery timelines.</span></span><br> <br> <span top-level planning.</span></span> </ul> <span style="font-size: 12.0pt;"><span style=""><strong>Key Qualifications:</strong></span></span> <ul> <li style="margin-right: 0.0in;"><span style="font-size: style="">Proficiency in DRC/LVS/ERC verification flows (e.g., Calibre, PVS, IC Validator).</span></span> <li style="margin-right: 0.0in;"><span style="font-size: 12.0pt;"><span style="">Solid understanding of layout challenges including IR drop, EM, RC delay, crosstalk, self-heating, and analog matching techniques.</span></span> <li style="margin-right: 0.0in;"><span style="font-size: 12.0pt;"><span style="">Hands-on experience designing layouts for precision analog blocks like SD-ADC, SAR-ADC, bandgaps, and regulators.</span></span> <li style="margin-right: 0.0in;"><span style="">Experience with RC extraction and EM/IR analysis is a plus.</span></span> <li style="margin-right: 0.0in;"><span style="font-size: 12.0pt;"><span style="">Strong communication skills and are seeking a highly experienced <strong>EDW Sr. Healthcare Technical Analyst </strong>for a large, direct client in Springfield, IL. </p> <p><strong>Primary Responsibilities:</strong></p> <ul> provider data supporting data warehouse downstream reporting and analytics. <li>Developing and supporting technical training materials. <li>Modifying existing technical documentation for business initiatives through data analysis, writing business requirements and user acceptance testing of various systems. <li>5+ years of experience serving as a technical analyst in healthcare (payor). <li>3+ years of experience working specifically with Medicaid programs, MMIS/MES or related systems. <li>3+ years of experience in knowledge management creating, organizing, sharing, and optimizing knowledge within an enterprise organization using tools such as Microsoft 365, AI-enabled search, MS SharePoint/Teams, and JIRA. <li>Proven ability to lead communication (written and verbal) at the customer Qualifications:</strong></p> <ul> <li>Master’s Degree in related field is preferred. <li>5+ years of experience as a technical analyst in payor healthcare. <li>3+ years of experience writing SQL using Enterprise Data Warehouse - Sr. Healthcare Technical Analyst <li>Knowledge of data integration, software enhancements/planning and agile methodologies <li>Experience with using Azure DevOps, SharePoint, MS Project, Visio </ul>

job.title: High Performance Computing Administrator (32447)
job.description: <p>The HPC Administrator’s primary focus is to monitor, maintain, troubleshoot and support HPC nodes which are integral to the day-to-day operation of our client. These activities include managing the hardware, software installations and configuration, optimization and management of the environment. Other activities include operational, day-to-day requests including migration of nodes, system access requests, resolution of security alerts, and providing second level problem assessment, triage, research, and resolution of incidents and requests, and capable of applying technical expertise at a superior level. Assist with the creation and publication of end user documentation as new technology is released and systems are migrated.</p> <p>Candidates must be willing to be onsite in the office at least 4 days per week.</p> <p><strong>Main Responsibilities</strong></p> <ul> <li>Identify, diagnose, and resolve level two problems for users of the software and hardware, LAN and WAN, VPN, the Internet, mobile devices, and new computer technology; communicate solutions to end-users. <li>Respond to more complex issues (second line support) escalated by the first line support using problem-solving skills and analysis to identify root causes of issues, determine course of action and propose creative solutions. <li>Manage day-day operations and support of the HPC environment (Linux). <li>Take ownership of capacity, availability and performance of the HPC cluster(s). <li>Support end users in the submission and management of jobs based on Slurm and OpenHPC. <li>Migrate existing nodes as required to Linux. <li>Implement and manage a system based on Foreman or similar to manage patching and oversee cluster management. <li>Implement patches and upgrades to Linux, Slurm and OpenHPC as required. <li>Install new servers and storage, build new clusters, configure and manage Linux distributions, hypervisors (KVM) and tooling. <li>Automate where possible to increase efficiency of operations. <li>Execute upon firewall access requests to the environment. <li>Escalate priority support issues to senior staff and/or other corporate technology groups <li>Collect and document all relevant information prior to escalation to allow senior staff to operate efficiently <li>Document, track and monitor problems to ensure timely resolution. <li>Assist in tracking helpdesk calls pertaining to application, networking, and systems problems and issues. <li>Assign username, password and access right permissions for multiple proprietary applications, as well as client software. <li>Identity Management and multifactor authentication with integration between Active Directory and Linux platforms. <li>Perform hardware & software audits. <li>Product research and evaluation. <li>Provide emergency support on incidents as required. <li>Perform occasional after-hours maintenance. <li>Incident on-call rotation as required. <li>Day-to-day operational support. </ul> <p><strong>Education & Experience Required</strong></p> <ul> <li>A Diploma or Degree in a relevant area of study with a preference for Computer Science together with demonstrated operational network-related experience. <li>Minimum of 2 years in Information Technology (with a related University Degree) or minimum of 7 years in Information Technology (with a three-year College Diploma). <li>Industry certifications such as MCSE, CISSP are a strong asset. </ul> <p><strong>Specialized Skills, Knowledge & Abilities</strong></p> <ul> <li>In-depth and demonstrated experience in the installation and operation of Linux platforms in an Enterprise environment (Ubuntu/RedHat). <li>Experience in the use of KVM or other hypervisors. <li>Experience in HPC tools such as Slurm, LSF or GridEngine. <li>Demonstrated knowledge of HPC clusters and use cases. <li>Working technical knowledge of network systems. <li>Working technical knowledge of current systems software, protocols and standards including Active Directory. <li>Identity management using Microsoft Identity Manager and Azure AD Connect. <li>Solid understanding of the Windows based endpoints. <li>Solid scripting experience (e.g. Bash) <li>Excellent written and oral communication skills. <li>Excellent problem-solving skills. <li>Strong analytical and troubleshooting skills <li>Strong interpersonal and organizational skills. <li>Must be well organized and able to grasp system concepts and communicate their applications. <li>Must be capable of quickly learning new systems and associated software applications for proficient execution of tasks. <li>Ability to manage multiple demands with time related constraints in a fast-paced environment. <li>Prioritize and schedule work as necessary to maintain department standards and service level agreements <li>Ability to speak effectively before groups of internal employees, communicate technical information, create and deliver presentations and information sessions to both technical and nontechnical personnel. <li>Demonstrated experience in applying technical expertise and in-depth evaluation to solve complex problems in own area of expertise. <li>Ability to create and maintain documentation and training materials, including KB articles, for technical staff and end-user audiences. <li>Microsoft Windows experience is an asset. <li>Bilingualism (English/French) is an asset. </ul> <p><strong>Decision Making & Supervision</strong></p> <ul> <li>Make decisions and recommendations within established procedures, based on troubleshooting and analysis. <li>Manage operating system and tooling upgrades. <li>Coordination with helpdesk, network/telecom, platform, and security teams. <li>Work under minimum supervision. </ul> <p><strong>Working Conditions</strong></p> <ul> <li>Generally comfortable working conditions with lifting and onsite installations. <li>Moderate visual concentration in use of video display terminal. <li>Appropriate security clearances required. <li>Occasional off-hours support may be required. <li>Participation in group pager rotation (‘on call’). </ul>

job.title: Senior System Engineer (32529)
job.description: <p>The Senior System Engineer will contribute to our clients program in conducting advance performance assessment studies for system configurations as needed to provide solution for complex customer needs. Using his / her expertise in satellite communications, orbital configuration and large communication networks, the candidate will define solutions with enough details to enable implementation across their system. </p> <p><strong>Main Responsibilities</strong></p> <ul> <li>Develop new solutions to commercial needs using their system, including among others solutions for low latency high capacity services, hosted satellite (space relay) services, mobile services, and other new configurations to support opportunities. <li>Support sales activities by evaluating complex use cases using internal and commercially available simulation tools. <li>Evaluate system performance boundaries by incorporating realistic user traffic profiles and terminal mix. <li>Help prepare and manage feature development roadmap in collaboration with commercial and engineering teams by evaluating value-add. <li>Develop technical documentation and reports. <li>Prepare and deliver high quality technical presentations supporting the delivery of solutions. </ul> <p><strong>Education and Experience Required</strong></p> <ul> <li>B. Sc. in Electrical, Computer or System Engineering and a minimum of 5 years of relevant experience in satellite communications or other large communication systems. <li>Experience in system simulations and service performance assessments. <li>Programming experience in Matlab and / or Python. <li>Knowledge of radio communication systems and/or satellite communication is desirable (experience with link budgets is an asset). </ul> <p><strong>Specialized Knowledge, Skills and Abilities</strong></p> <ul> <li>Creative problem-solver with thorough attention to detail. <li>Highly collaborative team-player who can quickly earn the confidence of co-workers and teammates. <li>Excellent oral and written communication skills. <li>Experience with STK for orbital analyses is an asset. <li>Fluent in English, written and oral. <li>Computers running Windows and Linux </ul>

job.title: Systems Configuration Identification Specialist (32646)
job.description: <p><strong>Main Responsibilities</strong></p> <p><strong>Configuration Identification</strong></p> <ul> <li> <p>Support and coordinate activities to establish rules for configuration item (CI) selection and baseline content definition.</p> <li> <p>Assist in selecting configuration items at appropriate levels of the product structure, including determining required configuration documentation for each CI.</p> </ul> <p><strong>Asset and Physical Systems Configuration Management</strong></p> <ul> <li> <p>Define, develop, and manage processes, procedures, and tools to identify, document, and control physical assets for a large-scale communications system.</p> <li> <p>Provide support for export control compliance processes such as ITAR.</p> <li> <p>Maintain an inventory of system assets (hardware).</p> <li> <p>Control and document system, hardware, and software configurations, including both "as-designed" and "as-built" baselines.</p> </ul> <p><strong>Software Configuration Management – Release Monitoring</strong></p> <ul> <li> <p>Collaborate with technical teams and project management to define roles and responsibilities for configuration and release management.</p> <li> <p>Work with development, test environment, and verification teams to define and document processes for managing software releases.</p> <li> <p>For each release, verify required documentation is complete, approved, and captured, and ensure release packages are created in accordance with established procedures.</p> <li> <p>Confirm that pending or outstanding changes do not impact planned test or release activities.</p> <li> <p>Support development, lab, and test teams to ensure timely and accurate release execution.</p> <li> <p>Assist with impact assessments and update the CI Tree and related configuration documentation to reflect approved changes.</p> <li> <p>Support preparation and execution of configuration item status accounting and configuration audits.</p> <li> <p>Provide subject matter expertise on configuration management (CM) processes, standards, and systems.</p> <li> <p>Contribute to requirements management and traceability process documentation and improvement.</p> <li> <p>Develop training materials for CM identification, software/release management, and general CM procedures.</p> <li> <p>Participate in continuous improvement initiatives to enhance CM process efficiency, reliability, and cost-effectiveness.</p> </ul> <p><strong>Document and Library Management Support</strong></p> <ul> <li> <p>Initiate updates to documentation based on approved change requests.</p> <li> <p>Collaborate with document management personnel to track and complete implementation of documentation updates.</p> <li> <p>Ensure all released documents are logged, captured, and statused in the document management system.</p> <li> <p>Act as backup support for document management responsibilities when needed.</p> </ul> <p><strong>Education & Experience – Required</strong></p> <ul> <li> <p>Bachelor’s or college degree in engineering, science, or a related field (or equivalent combination of education and experience).</p> <li> <p>3–6 years of experience in an engineering design environment working with systems, hardware, software, and test teams.</p> <li> <p>2+ years of experience in configuration and/or data management.</p> <li> <p>2+ years of experience in release management.</p> <li> <p>Formal training, certification, or experience with CM standards (e.g., CM2, ANSI-EIA 649, ISO 10007).</p> </ul> <p><strong>Education & Experience – Assets</strong></p> <ul> <li> <p>Experience with software configuration management tools and processes.</p> <li> <p>Strong verbal and written communication skills with both technical and non-technical audiences.</p> <li> <p>Experience in high-performing, multidisciplinary development teams.</p> <li> <p>Collaborative, team-oriented, and self-driven.</p> <li> <p>Skilled in Microsoft Office at an intermediate level.</p> <li> <p>Bilingual in English and French is an asset (but not required).</p> </ul>

job.description: <span style="font-size: 12.0pt;"><span style="font-family: Aptos , sans-serif;"><strong><span style="">POSITION OVERVIEW</span></strong><br> <br> Looking for a <strong><span style="">Senior .NET Full Stack Developer</span></strong> to support the architecture and development of critical application features. The ideal candidate is a well-rounded developer who enjoys both front-end and back-end work, and thrives in collaborative, agile, and remote-first teams.</span></span><br> <br> <br> <span style="font-size: 12.0pt;"><span style="font-family: Aptos , sans-serif;"><strong><span style="">CORE QUALIFICATIONS</span></strong></span></span> <ul> <li>5+ years of experience in full-stack development delivering scalable, production-ready solutions <li>Strong knowledge of:<br> • C#, ASP.NET MVC<br> • Entity Framework and SQL Server<br> • JavaScript, HTML5, CSS <li>Solid understanding of software architecture principles, design patterns, and clean coding standards <li>Hands-on experience with Git and modern source control practices <li>Bachelor’s in Computer Science or equivalent practical experience <li>Must be authorized to work in the U.S. <li>Open to limited travel (2–4 times annually) for team collaboration </ul> <br> <span style="font-size: 12.0pt;"><span style="font-family: Aptos , sans-serif;"><strong><span style="">PREFERRED EXPERIENCE / NICE TO HAVE</span></strong></span></span> <ul> <li>Experience with modern .NET (.NET Core / .NET 6+) <li>Familiarity with Microsoft Azure and DevOps tools <li>Understanding of containerization (Docker, Linux containers) <li>Proficiency with RESTful API development <li>Exposure to cloud-based services (Azure preferred, AWS acceptable) <li>Experience with modern front-end frameworks like React, Angular, or Vue.js <li>Knowledge of CI/CD tools such as Azure DevOps, GitHub Actions, or Jenkins <li>Test-driven development (TDD) and experience with testing frameworks (xUnit, MSTest, NUnit, Jest, Mocha) <li>Security/authentication protocols (OAuth2, OpenID Connect, IdentityServer) <li>Event-driven architecture and messaging systems (e.g., RabbitMQ, Azure Service Bus, Kafka) </ul>

job.title: Cloud Site Reliability Engineer - Azure/AWS (34084)
job.description: <p><strong>Cloud Site Reliability Engineer – AWS & Azure</strong><br> <br> <br> <strong>Responsibilities</strong></p> <ul> <li>Oversee the design and improvement of infrastructure using SRE best practices, including IaC, recovery automation, and systems that detect and resolve issues independently. <li>Manage and fine-tune critical services across both cloud and on-prem environments: Kubernetes clusters, CI/CD pipelines, artifact registries, and custom workloads. <li>Enhance observability through intelligent logging, metrics, tracing, and alerting. Ensuring systems are transparent and actionable in real time. <li>Champion automation by eliminating repetitive tasks, from deployment workflows to security audits, through scripting and tooling. <li>Elevate the developer experience for 80+ engineers and researchers by streamlining secure, reliable workflows across hybrid and cloud-native platforms. <li>Take ownership of IAM governance across platforms like Azure AD and AWS IAM. Implement lifecycle automation, auditing, and access controls. <li>Foster a culture of operational excellence with strong practices around security, incident management, and resilience engineering. <li>Act as a trusted partner to developers and researchers, enabling their speed and innovation without compromising stability. </ul> <p><br> <strong>Experience</strong></p> <ul> <li>Experience in Site Reliability Engineering, DevOps, or Systems Engineering within fast-paced, technically demanding environments. <li>Strong background in Linux systems and cloud infrastructure, with hands-on experience in AWS (primary) and Azure environments. <li>Solid command of Kubernetes and container orchestration in production environments. <li>Expertise in Infrastructure as Code tools such as Ansible, building reproducible, scalable infrastructure is second nature to you. <li>Deep experience in observability and incident response: you know how to set up effective monitoring, handle incidents, and lead blameless post-mortems. <li>A security-first mindset, especially when it comes to protecting distributed systems and developer workflows. <li>Proven ability to support and optimize CI/CD pipelines, container image builds, and artifact lifecycle management. <li>Strong communication and collaboration skills. You build trust across teams and advocate for thoughtful, scalable solutions. <li>Bonus if you’ve worked with event-driven architectures using technologies like Kafka. </ul>

job.title: Banking Technology Integration Consultant - Lockbox/Payments (32606)
job.description: <p>We are seeking an experienced Banking Technology Integration Consultant (Lockbox/Payments) Implementation Specialist to support a large financial institution’s transformation project. This role focuses on the implementation and integration of cheque imaging, lockbox services, exception/returns handling, and ensuring compliance with North American regulatory requirements.</p> <p><strong>Key Responsibilities:</strong></p> <ul> <li> <p>Lead and support the implementation of cheque processing technologies and lockbox solutions.</p> <li> <p>Conduct discovery sessions with business stakeholders and product owners.</p> <li> <p>Develop strategy, planning documentation, and ensure smooth technical integration.</p> <li> <p>Interface with vendors and internal stakeholders to gather requirements and deliver end-to-end solutions.</p> <li> <p>Ensure compliance with Canada and U.S. cheque processing regulations.</p> </ul> <p><strong>Qualifications:</strong></p> <ul> <li> <p>10+ years of experience in financial services or banking technology.</p> <li> <p>Proven experience in cheque processing and lockbox solution implementation.</p> <li> <p>Familiarity with North American regulatory requirements.</p> <li> <p>Experience working at Symcor or implementing similar solutions in the U.S. is highly desirable.</p> <li> <p>Strong communication and stakeholder engagement skills.</p> </ul>

job.title: FPGA Developer, Senior (32549)
job.description: <p><strong>Overview:</strong><br /> A leading provider of real-time video processing technology is seeking a <strong>Senior FPGA Developer</strong> to join its core signal processing team. This group is responsible for developing high-performance media transport and processing systems used by global clients in live production, broadcast, and media environments.</p> <p>This is an opportunity to work on cutting-edge, high-bandwidth systems built on advanced FPGA platforms—delivering critical real-time features that enable professional-grade media production. You’ll be surrounded by a highly experienced team that values innovation, collaboration, and practical problem solving.</p> <p><strong>Key Responsibilities:</strong></p> <ul> <li> <p>Design and implement RTL for advanced real-time media systems with interfaces including memory, PCIe, and hardware-accelerated video processing.</p> </li> <li> <p>Develop transport protocol implementations (e.g., SDI, SMPTE 2110) within FPGAs.</p> </li> <li> <p>Collaborate on system architecture—reviewing schematics, optimizing clocking, thermal considerations, and FPGA resource allocation.</p> </li> <li> <p>Perform full IO ring designs for leading FPGA families (e.g., Arria10, Stratix-10, Ultrascale+, Agilex).</p> </li> <li> <p>Define and document high-level system requirements; support component selection and scheduling.</p> </li> <li> <p>Create simulation testbenches (Verilog/SystemVerilog); perform functional verification and debugging.</p> </li> <li> <p>Collaborate cross-functionally with software, hardware, and manufacturing teams through the full product lifecycle.</p> </li> <li> <p>Mentor peers and support technical knowledge sharing within the team.</p> </li> </ul> <p><strong>Requirements:</strong></p> <ul> <li> <p>5+ years of hands-on FPGA design experience, preferably with exposure to video or audio systems.</p> </li> <li> <p>Strong Verilog/SystemVerilog and scripting skills (TCL).</p> </li> <li> <p>Experience with Intel and/or Xilinx FPGAs and their respective toolchains (Quartus, Vivado).</p> </li> <li> <p>Familiarity with high-speed serial interfaces, DDR3/4, HBM, PLLs, and signal integrity principles.</p> </li> <li> <p>Excellent debugging and validation skills; proficiency with lab tools (oscilloscopes, logic analyzers, WFMs, etc.).</p> </li> <li> <p>Background in embedded systems (Linux, bash, C/C++) considered a plus.</p> </li> <li> <p>Understanding of media production workflows and digital video standards (SMPTE, HDR, SDI) is advantageous.</p> </li> <li> <p>Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced engineering environment.</p> </li> </ul>
