job.title: ASIC Development Engineer (32476)
job.description: <p><strong>Job Title: Senior ASIC Design Engineer – Optical Communication Systems</strong></p> <p>Our client’s team is expanding and seeking highly motivated, experienced professional engineers to join in the development of next-generation systems within a fast-growing and competitive environment. Candidates must hold a degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, Computer Science, or possess equivalent experience.</p> <p><strong>Main Responsibilities:</strong></p> <ul> <li>Design and development of state-of-the-art electronic devices and intellectual property (IP) for optical communication systems <li>Demonstrated experience working with deep sub-micron silicon technologies <li>Collaboration within multi-site international development teams <li>Design of ASIC devices for optical signal processing </ul> <p><strong>Required Skills and Qualifications:</strong></p> <ul> <li>Master’s degree or Ph.D. in Electronic Engineering, Telecommunication Engineering, or a related discipline <li>Minimum of 8 years of proven experience in deep sub-micron ASIC design <li>Proficiency in VHDL/Verilog development and ASIC verification <li>Preferred experience in digital signal processing (DSP) and forward error correction (FEC) design <li>Experience in high-speed analog design <li>Strong analytical thinking and problem-solving skills <li>Effective teamwork and ability to collaborate with international teams across multiple time zones <li>Excellent verbal and written communication skills <li>Proficiency in English </ul>

job.title: SAP FICO Functional Lead (32637)
job.description: <p>Myticas Consulting is seeking an experienced <strong>SAP FICO Functional Lead</strong> for a long-term contract opportunity supporting a high-profile SAP S/4HANA transformation project within the oil and gas sector.</p> <p>This leadership role will play a key part in driving finance-related workstreams, providing expert guidance on core SAP FI/CO modules, and aligning solution delivery to the needs of an asset-intensive organization.</p> <p><strong>Key Responsibilities:</strong></p> <ul> <li> <p>Lead the design, configuration, and deployment of SAP FI/CO modules (GL, AP, AR, AA, CO-OM, PCA, etc.)</p> <li> <p>Collaborate closely with finance and business stakeholders to gather requirements and define functional specs</p> <li> <p>Drive integration with upstream and downstream modules and legacy systems</p> <li> <p>Ensure alignment with industry best practices and EY methodology for SAP implementations</p> <li> <p>Support UAT, cutover planning, data migration, and go-live activities</p> <li> <p>Lead or mentor junior consultants and ensure effective knowledge transfer</p> </ul> <p><strong>Required Qualifications:</strong></p> <ul> <li> <p>10+ years of SAP FICO experience with at least 2 full-cycle implementations</p> <li> <p>Proven functional leadership experience on large-scale SAP projects</p> <li> <p>Strong background in asset-intensive industries (oil and gas preferred)</p> <li> <p>Hands-on experience with S/4HANA Finance (nice to have but not required)</p> <li> <p>Excellent communication and stakeholder engagement skills</p> <li> <p>Ability to work onsite in Vancouver for the majority of the engagement</p> </ul> <p><strong>Contract Details:</strong></p> <ul> <li> <p>Duration: Initial 12 months with potential extension</p> <li> <p>Work Location: Vancouver, BC (Calgary-based candidates may be considered with travel flexibility)</p> </ul>

job.title: Senior Change Management Specialist (32612)
job.description: <p>Our client, a leading professional services firm, is urgently seeking an experienced <strong>Senior Change Management Specialist</strong> to support a critical engagement in Halifax. The ideal candidate will have deep experience driving change management initiatives across large-scale IT or ERP transformation projects—ideally in the public sector. This position requires a skilled professional who can plan, manage, and execute structured change initiatives while collaborating with various stakeholder groups.</p> <p><strong>Key Responsibilities:</strong></p> <ul> <li> <p>Lead the delivery of change management work plans, including activities like stakeholder engagement, change impact assessment, and organizational change action planning.</p> <li> <p>Coordinate logistics, communications, meeting schedules, and prep materials for change management initiatives.</p> <li> <p>Oversee and guide Change Specialists involved in associated streams.</p> <li> <p>Track and report weekly progress to the OCM or Communications Lead.</p> <li> <p>Identify, document, and escalate risks, issues, or decisions related to business readiness and delivery.</p> <li> <p>Champion continuous improvement within the change stream.</p> <li> <p>Develop and deliver change management knowledge transfer plans.</p> </ul> <p><strong>Required Qualifications:</strong></p> <ul> <li> <p>5+ years of experience leading change initiatives, particularly focused on:</p> <ul> <li> <p>People & business process change</p> <li> <p>IT implementation change</p> </ul> <li> <p>Hands-on delivery of change management programs using frameworks such as PROSCI or similar.</p> <li> <p>Strong workshop facilitation experience (1-on-1, small and large groups).</p> <li> <p>Excellent communication, problem-solving, and stakeholder engagement skills.</p> <li> <p>Strong organizational and prioritization capabilities.</p> <li> <p>Proficiency in MS Office tools.</p> </ul>

job.title: Internal Controls Analyst - SOX/ICFR (32579)
job.description: <p>Our client is seeking a skilled Internal Controls Analyst (SOX/ICFR) to support internal control and financial reporting activities. The successful candidate will participate in or lead client meetings, address inquiries related to information request lists, and perform and review ICFR control testing. Strong project management capabilities are also required.</p> <p><strong>Responsibilities:</strong></p> <ul> <li>Participate in and potentially lead meetings with clients <li>Respond to client questions related to information request lists <li>Perform and review testing of internal controls over financial reporting (ICFR) <li>Support project management and tracking of control testing activities </ul> <p><strong>Must-Have Skills:</strong></p> <ul> <li>Practical working experience with ICFR, SOX 404, and NI 52-109 <li>Strong understanding of internal control frameworks <li>Excellent communication and client-facing skills </ul> <p><strong>Preferred Qualifications:</strong></p> <ul> <li>CA, CPA, or CIA designation <li>Experience in the retail sector </ul>

job.title: Software Developer - Network Management System (32445)
job.description: <p>As a Network Management System Developer, you’ll be responsible for ensuring the smooth operation of our network by designing, implementing, testing and maintaining Operational Support Systems (OSS). Your role will be instrumental in optimizing network performance, enhancing efficiency, and ensuring a seamless customer experience.</p> <p><strong>Main Responsibilities</strong></p> <ul> <li>Design network management solutions to monitor and manage Carrier <li>Ethernet and IP services, ensuring optimal capacity, performance and reliability <li>Define configurations and notification data models using YANG <li>Define real-time network monitoring solutions <li>Program network automation with gNMI/gNOI/NETCONF/RESTCONF <li>Design, Develop and maintain automated scripts and tools to verify NMS functionality <li>Work with vendors to implement new OSS/NMS solutions <li>Review and approve design documents, test strategies, plans, and scripts <li>Maintain accurate documentation of OSS/NMS requirements, configurations, processes, and procedures <li>Resolve complex OSS/NMS implementation and network problems with cross-functional teams <li>Enforce security best practices to protect network systems and data integrity </ul> <p><strong>Education and Experience Required</strong></p> <ul> <li>Bachelor’s in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, or related field <li>2-5 experience in a similar role. <li>Proficient in Layer 2/3 protocols, YANG modeling, gRPC/gNMI/gNOI <li>Experience designing network management systems using Layer 2/3 protocols <li>Programming skills in modern C++, GNU C, Go, Python 3.x <li>TDD and BDD test frameworks <li>Knowledge of developing software in container hosted in <strong>Linux </strong>environment and microservices <li>Knowledge of Protobuf, XML, JSON IETF encoding, and template language (Jinja2) <li>Good problem-solving, and communication skills <li>Experience with NMS products like Netcracker Digital OSS, ONAP, Ciena Blue Planet, Amdocs </ul> <p><strong>Knowledge in Protocols and Standards:</strong></p> <ul> <li>Layer 3 protocols: IP, OSPF, BGP, MPLS, SR-MPLS <li>Layer 2 protocols: Ethernet, VLAN, STP, LACP <li>MEF and TMF Standards </ul>

job.title: Senior Packet Processing Software Developer (32079)
job.description: <p>We are seeking a highly skilled <strong>Senior Software Engineer</strong> with expertise in <strong>Packet Processing</strong> to join our team. The ideal candidate will have extensive experience in designing and optimizing high-performance network systems, with a strong background in developing scalable, low-latency solutions for data-intensive environments. In this role, you will work on cutting-edge technologies to enhance network protocols and packet processing frameworks. Your contributions will play a key role in delivering robust, reliable, and efficient network operations, ensuring our systems meet the evolving demands of modern infrastructure.</p> <hr> <p><strong>Main Responsibilities:</strong></p> <ul> <li>Collaborate with experienced engineers in the design, coding, testing, and maintenance of software applications. <li>Develop and maintain embedded software modules using programming languages such as <strong>C++</strong> and <strong>Python</strong>. <li>Design and implement high-performance packet processing applications using <strong>DPDK</strong> and similar frameworks. <li>Optimize network functions for maximum throughput and minimal latency. <li>Develop and maintain packet processing pipelines for various network functions. <li>Troubleshoot complex performance issues in packet processing applications. <li>Assist in the implementation of networking solutions to ensure seamless communication between software components. <li>Contribute to the development of software tools, libraries, and frameworks to enhance overall product quality and efficiency. <li>Participate in code reviews and provide constructive feedback to improve code quality and adherence to coding standards. <li>Collaborate with the team to troubleshoot and resolve software defects and technical issues. <li>Support the integration of software components on <strong>Linux</strong> operating systems. <li>Assist in the testing and validation of software features to ensure functionality and performance meet specified requirements. <li>Utilize cloud technologies to enhance software deployment and management. <li>Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including product managers and designers, to understand requirements and contribute to technical discussions. <li>Maintain clear and organized documentation of software designs, processes, and development tasks. <li>Demonstrate effective teamwork and communication skills, both orally and in writing. <li>Lead the design, development, and implementation of advanced satellite ground segment software systems, ensuring high performance, scalability, and reliability. </ul> <hr> <p><strong>Education & Experience Required:</strong></p> <ul> <li>Bachelor&apos;s or Master&apos;s degree in <strong>Computer Science</strong>, <strong>Computer Engineering</strong>, <strong>Electrical Engineering</strong>, or a related field. <li>In-depth knowledge of <strong>packet processing development</strong>. <li>Experience with the <strong>Vector Packet Processing (VPP)</strong> framework is a plus. <li>Deep understanding of <strong>DPDK architecture and APIs</strong>. <li>Familiarity with modern <strong>NIC features</strong> (e.g., RSS, checksum offload, scatter-gather). <li>Experience with <strong>AF_XDP</strong> or similar kernel bypass technologies. <li>Strong understanding of <strong>Linux-based network stacks</strong>, kernel modules, and performance optimization. <li>Ideally <strong>8+ years</strong> of experience in <strong>C/C++</strong> for low-level network programming and high-performance packet processing. <li>Solid understanding of networking concepts and protocols, including <strong>TCP/IP</strong>, <strong>UDP</strong>, <strong>VXLAN</strong>, <strong>GRE</strong>, etc. <li>Familiarity with cloud technologies is a plus. <li>Strong analytical and problem-solving skills. <li>Ability to collaborate effectively within a diverse team. <li>Excellent oral and written communication skills. <li>Enthusiasm for learning new technologies and tools. <li>Detail-oriented with a commitment to producing high-quality software. <li>Ability to design software with consideration for hardware resource constraints. <li>Experience in <strong>software development</strong> for <strong>satellite communication systems</strong> is a plus. </ul>

job.title: SAP Data Migration Lead (32597)
job.description: <p>Myticas Consulting is hiring an experienced <strong>SAP Data Migration Lead</strong> to join a long-term S/4HANA transformation engagement with a major Canadian enterprise client. The role will focus on leading complex SAP data migration activities with a strong emphasis on SAP BODS, technical leadership, and cross-functional collaboration with finance and business teams.</p> <hr> <h3><strong>Key Responsibilities:</strong></h3> <ul> <li>Lead SAP data conversion strategy and execution for large-scale SAP S/4HANA migration projects. <li>Interface daily with client stakeholders including executives, project managers, and technical teams. <li>Manage full data migration lifecycle: data readiness, architecture, mock loads, validation, and cutover. <li>Provide technical leadership to SAP BODS development teams. <li>Collaborate across modules including FI, CO, MM, EWM, PM, PPM, and HR. <li>Deliver high-quality migration outputs on schedule and budget. </ul> <hr> <h3><strong>Required Experience & Skills:</strong></h3> <ul> <li>8–10 years in SAP MDM/Data Migration; 5+ full-cycle implementations. <li>Deep hands-on expertise with <strong>SAP BODS (BusinessObjects Data Services)</strong> for ETLV tasks. <li>Solid understanding of SAP data migration tools (LTMC, LSMW, IDOCs, custom programs). <li>Strong experience with data profiling, cleansing, validation, de-duplication, and transformation. <li>Experience migrating data between SAP ECC, SAP CFIN, and SAP S/4HANA (brownfield migration). <li>Knowledge of master and transactional data objects (e.g., Company Code, Legal Entity, FI/CO). <li>Proficient in SQL and data quality reporting dashboards. <li>Previous experience supporting data migration for clients in the <strong>Energy sector</strong> is an asset. </ul> <hr> <h3><strong>Soft Skills:</strong></h3> <ul> <li>Strong communication and presentation skills. <li>Proven ability to lead client workshops and technical teams. <li>Ability to challenge and advise stakeholders with innovative solutions. <li>Comfortable working in fast-paced, client-facing environments. </ul>

job.title: Technical Systems Administrator/Trainer (32661)
job.description: <p><strong>Job Title:</strong> Technical Systems Administrator / Trainer<br> <strong>Location:</strong> Irvine, CA (Dupont Drive) – Hybrid (3 days onsite, 2 days remote)<br> <strong>Company:</strong> Myticas’s direct client based in Irvine, CA<br> <strong>Duration:</strong> 12+ months (possibility of extension)</p> <hr> <h3><strong>Top Skills, Experience, and Education Required:</strong></h3> <ul> <li> <p>2–4 years of experience with SharePoint, including site creation and administration</p> <li> <p>2–4 years of professional experience in one or more of the following roles:</p> <ul> </ul><li> <p>Functional Systems Administrator</p> <li> <p>Configuration Manager</p> <li> <p>Solution Architect</p> <li> <p>Project Manager</p> <li> <p>Consultant</p> <li> <p>Trainer</p> </ul> <li> <p>At least 2 years of experience administering Atlassian products (Confluence or Jira preferred)</p> <li> <p>Strong interpersonal and relationship-building skills</p> <li> <p>Proven ability to communicate effectively and partner with key stakeholders</p> <hr> <h3><strong>Job Summary:</strong></h3> <p>Our client is seeking a <strong>Technical Systems Administrator / Trainer</strong> to support the development, management, and daily operations of SharePoint sites and Atlassian tools. This role plays a critical part in enhancing user adoption, building effective training programs, and optimizing system workflows.</p> <p>You will provide hands-on support to users, lead training initiatives, and act as a technical liaison across teams to ensure the platforms are being used efficiently and effectively. Your responsibilities will include system administration, process improvement, user onboarding, and cross-functional collaboration to drive tool adoption and process scalability.</p> <p>The ideal candidate is experienced in SharePoint and Atlassian products, thrives in a dynamic environment, enjoys solving complex problems, and excels in working with a diverse team.</p> <hr> <h3><strong>Key Responsibilities:</strong></h3> <ul> <li> <p>Collaborate with Business Technology and Implementation teams to identify customization opportunities and optimize SharePoint usage</p> <li> <p>Build and configure SharePoint sites and folder structures tailored to specific business needs</p> <li> <p>Serve as the primary administrator for SharePoint and Atlassian (Confluence, Jira), ensuring system functionality, content quality, and process alignment</p> <li> <p>Generate and distribute regular and ad hoc reports to measure system performance and KPIs</p> <li> <p>Design and document workflows, processes, and best practices for system usage</p> <li> <p>Translate business requirements into system enhancements and workflow improvements</p> <li> <p>Assess and recommend integration opportunities for additional tools and platforms</p> <li> <p>Work closely with IT to test, implement, and maintain system updates and functionalities</p> <li> <p>Lead special projects, including training development, project management, and system reporting</p> <li> <p>Conduct training sessions and maintain user support documentation</p> <li> <p>Liaise with vendors for technical support and coordinate training resources</p> <li> <p>Promote proper system usage and best practices among team members</p> </ul> <hr> <h3><strong>Required Qualifications:</strong></h3> <ul> <li> <p>2–4 years of experience building and managing SharePoint sites</p> <li> <p>2–4 years of professional experience in a systems administration, training, or related role</p> <li> <p>Creative problem-solving skills with a focus on workflow optimization</p> <li> <p>Ability to lead projects, manage deadlines, and balance multiple priorities</p> <li> <p>Strong communication and collaboration skills with the ability to influence stakeholders</p> <li> <p>Demonstrated ability to work independently in a fast-paced environment</p> </ul> <hr> <h3><strong>Preferred Qualifications (Nice to Have):</strong></h3> <ul> <li> <p>1–2 years of experience administering Atlassian tools (Confluence, Jira)</p> <li> <p>Experience using APIs to build tool integrations (e.g., Slack API, Jira API)</p> </ul>

job.title: Senior Cloud Operations Manager (32293)
job.description: <p><strong>SCOPE</strong></p> <p>We are seeking a highly skilled and motivated Manager, Cloud Operations to lead and optimize our Azure cloud infrastructure and services. This role is critical in ensuring the scalability, reliability, and security of our cloud environments while driving operational excellence. The ideal candidate will have a deep understanding of cloud architectures, automation, and best-in-class operational practices.</p> <p><strong>RESPONSIBILITIES</strong></p> <ul> <li>Lead the Cloud Operations team to ensure high availability, performance, and security of cloud-based applications and services. <li>Develop and execute a strategic roadmap for cloud operations, aligning with business objectives. <li>Oversee incident management, disaster recovery, and business continuity strategies for cloud environments to support and align efforts to meet customer needs. <li>Drive automation and infrastructure-as-code (IaC) adoption to improve efficiency and reduce operational overhead. <li>Optimize cloud cost management and governance to ensure cost-effective usage of resources. <li>Collaborate with security, compliance, and IT teams to enforce best practices and regulatory requirements. <li>Establish and monitor KPIs, SLAs, and performance metrics to continuously improve service delivery. <li>Provide leadership, mentorship, and development opportunities for a team of cloud engineers and operations professionals. <li>Communicate proactively with customers and internal team members to deliver business value as a part of daily work management. <li>Stay up to date with emerging technologies, trends, and industry best practices to drive innovation. </ul> <p><strong>REQUIRED TECHNICAL SKILLS & QUALIFICATIONS</strong></p> <ul> <li>Bachelor&apos;s or Master&apos;s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field. <li>Certifications in cloud technologies. <li>Industry-accepted certifications in management. <li>Domain knowledge of banking and financial institutions and/or large enterprise IT environment is desirable. <li>10+ years of experience in IT operations with at least 5 years focused on cloud services. <li>Proven experience in managing cloud environments (AWS or Azure) at an enterprise scale. <li>Strong understanding of automation tools (Terraform, Ansible, CloudFormation) and CI/CD pipelines. <li>Hands-on experience with monitoring, logging, and observability tools (Datadog, Splunk, Prometheus, Azure Monitoring, etc.). <li>Deep knowledge of networking, security best practices, and compliance frameworks (ISO, SOC2, NIST, etc.). <li>Strong leadership and team management skills with experience in developing high-performing teams. <li>Excellent problem-solving skills with a proactive approach to operational challenges. <li>Strong communication and stakeholder management skills. </ul> <p><strong>SOFT SKILLS</strong></p> <ul> <li>Customer-facing skills: Connect, Engage, Listen, Explain, Facilitate, Coordinate, Follow-through. <li>Strong, clear, and concise written and verbal communication skills. <li>Ability to communicate effectively at all levels of the organization. <li>Strong interpersonal skills and ability to foster team collaboration. <li>Ability to negotiate and convince. <li>Ability to identify innovative solutions to problems. <li>Out-of-the-box thinking approach. <li>Ability to conceptualize and articulate new approaches and solutions. <li>Ability to collaborate and communicate to achieve positive outcomes. <li>Detail-oriented. <li>Strong ability to prioritize and meet deadlines. <li>Able to work under stress and conflicting timelines when necessary. <li>Proactive with a strong desire to learn. <li>Self-driven, with high enthusiasm and ambition to succeed. </ul>

job.title: French Legal Invoice Analyst/Initial Reviewer (32444)
job.description: <p><strong>Location:</strong> Hybrid Contract Position | Minneapolis, MN<br /> <strong>NOTE: W2 Candidates Only!</strong></p> <p>Myticas&apos;s direct client, based in Minneapolis, MN, is seeking a <strong>Legal Invoice Analyst/Initial Reviewer</strong> for a hybrid contract position.</p> <hr /> <h3><strong>Position Overview:</strong></h3> <p>The <strong>Legal Invoice Analyst I</strong> is responsible for the prompt, accurate, and efficient auditing of electronically submitted legal fee and expense invoices from law firms and vendors. The selected candidate will ensure compliance with billing guidelines by adjusting invoice line items that violate provisions and documenting justifications for those adjustments. The analyst will also provide guidance to business unit partners on issues or opportunities within the Legal Billing Audit process.</p> <hr /> <h3><strong>Essential Responsibilities:</strong></h3> <ul> <li>Efficiently and accurately review legal invoice entries.</li> <li>Receive legal invoice assignments from the Operations Support Specialist or self-assign tasks from the intake queue.</li> <li>Verify compliance with legal billing guidelines for submitted invoices.</li> <li>Ensure the accuracy of UTBMS task codes (Fee, Activity, and Expense codes) applied to invoice line items.</li> <li>Document reasons for any adjustments made to invoice line items, specifying the violated billing guideline and rationale for the adjustment amount.</li> <li>Forward audited legal invoices through the appropriate review chain as required.</li> <li>Collaborate with Legal Invoice Analysts and Quality Assurance Analysts.</li> <li>Exercise discretion and sound judgment when making audit and adjustment decisions.</li> <li>Demonstrate a strong understanding of legal terminology and claims-related legal situations, with multijurisdictional exposure preferred.</li> <li>Work independently with minimal supervision after training.</li> <li>Utilize electronic legal bill submission and auditing software efficiently.</li> <li>Organize work to ensure the prompt and efficient review of legal invoices within designated timeframes.</li> <li>Apply basic business math skills and maintain appropriate business telephone etiquette.</li> </ul> <hr /> <h3><strong>Required Skills, Qualifications, and Experience:</strong></h3> <p><strong>Education:</strong></p> <ul> <li>Paralegal Certification or a Bachelor&apos;s Degree in a legal-related discipline, or equivalent work experience.</li> </ul> <p><strong>Experience:</strong></p> <ul> <li>1-3 years of experience in a legal services or legal auditing environment.</li> <li>Must speak, read and write&nbsp;<strong>French</strong>--for this opening.</li> <li>Familiarity with legal billing processes.</li> <li>Strong understanding of federal and/or state rules of civil procedure.</li> </ul> <p><strong>Technical Skills:</strong></p> <ul> <li>Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook).</li> <li>Experience with legal billing systems and processes.</li> </ul> <p><strong>Core Competencies:</strong></p> <ul> <li><strong>Teamwork:</strong> Collaborate effectively with the Legal Billing Audit Center of Excellence (LBACOE) and other business units while providing constructive feedback.</li> <li><strong>Problem Solving:</strong> Think independently and make sound decisions. Identify necessary resources to aid in decision-making and take proactive steps to resolve problems.</li> <li><strong>Leadership:</strong> Demonstrate personal accountability for day-to-day tasks and collaborate with other business units to achieve results.</li> <li><strong>Planning and Organizing:</strong> Prioritize tasks to achieve short- and long-term goals within designated timeframes.</li> <li><strong>Technology:</strong> Partner with technology experts to identify gaps and develop impactful solutions.</li> <li><strong>Learning:</strong> Adapt to changes in the marketplace and workforce by acquiring or modifying knowledge through study, experience, or instruction.</li> <li><strong>Initiative:</strong> Exhibit self-direction and translate ideas into action to achieve results.</li> </ul> INDSponsor

job.title: NMS Developer (32446)
job.description: <p>As a Network Management System Developer, you’ll be responsible for ensuring the smooth operation of our network by designing, implementing, testing and maintaining Operational Support Systems (OSS). Your role will be instrumental in optimizing network performance, enhancing efficiency, and ensuring a seamless customer experience.</p> <p><strong>Main Responsibilities</strong></p> <ul> <li>Design network management solutions to monitor and manage Carrier <li>Ethernet and IP services, ensuring optimal capacity, performance and reliability <li>Define configurations and notification data models using YANG <li>Define real-time network monitoring solutions <li>Program network automation with gNMI/gNOI/NETCONF/RESTCONF <li>Design, Develop and maintain automated scripts and tools to verify NMS functionality <li>Work with vendors to implement new OSS/NMS solutions <li>Review and approve design documents, test strategies, plans, and scripts <li>Maintain accurate documentation of OSS/NMS requirements, configurations, processes, and procedures <li>Resolve complex OSS/NMS implementation and network problems with cross-functional teams <li>Enforce security best practices to protect network systems and data integrity </ul> <p><strong>Education and Experience Required</strong></p> <ul> <li>Bachelor’s in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, or related field <li>2-5 experience in a similar role. <li>Proficient in Layer 2/3 protocols, YANG modeling, gRPC/gNMI/gNOI <li>Experience designing network management systems using Layer 2/3 protocols <li>Programming skills in modern C++, GNU C, Go, Python 3.x <li>TDD and BDD test frameworks <li>Knowledge of developing software in container hosted in <strong>Linux </strong>environment and microservices <li>Knowledge of Protobuf, XML, JSON IETF encoding, and template language (Jinja2) <li>Good problem-solving, and communication skills <li>Experience with NMS products like Netcracker Digital OSS, ONAP, Ciena Blue Planet, Amdocs </ul> <p><strong>Knowledge in Protocols and Standards:</strong></p> <ul> <li>Layer 3 protocols: IP, OSPF, BGP, MPLS, SR-MPLS <li>Layer 2 protocols: Ethernet, VLAN, STP, LACP <li>MEF and TMF Standards </ul>

job.title: Senior Technical Product Manager (34086)
job.description: <p><strong>Job Title: Senior Technical Product Manager</strong><br> <strong>Location: Coppell, TX (Hybrid)</strong><br> <strong>Type: Contract (W2 Only)</strong></p> <p><strong>About the Role:</strong><br> Myticas is seeking a <strong>Senior Technical Product Manager</strong> to support our direct client in Coppell, TX. This is a hybrid contract position available exclusively on a W2 basis.</p> <p>The Senior Technical Product Manager will serve as the critical link between customers, internal stakeholders, and development teams. This role involves deeply understanding customer needs, translating strategic product vision into actionable development tasks, and leading cross-functional collaboration to ensure the successful delivery of software solutions.</p> <p><strong>Key Responsibilities:</strong></p> <ul> <li> <p>Develop a comprehensive understanding of the product vision, target customer segments, and long-term priorities, while ensuring alignment with senior leadership and stakeholders.</p> <li> <p>Partner with internal teams—including engineering, marketing, sales, implementation, training, and support—to gather insights, align priorities, and ensure effective product development and launch execution.</p> <li> <p>Serve as the voice of the customer, working closely with UX and development teams to validate and refine solutions throughout the development lifecycle.</p> <li> <p>Conduct and facilitate customer engagements, in collaboration with UX teams, to explore unmet needs and test concepts and prototypes.</p> <li> <p>Translate business requirements into user stories and detailed acceptance criteria for development teams.</p> <li> <p>Lead Agile ceremonies including backlog grooming, sprint planning, and sprint reviews, ensuring outcomes align with business objectives.</p> <li> <p>Drive quarterly Agile planning and continuously build subject matter expertise to identify and implement product improvements.</p> <li> <p>Maintain and evolve detailed product roadmaps, prioritizing features across multiple quarters.</p> <li> <p>Coordinate with project managers and other product managers to manage dependencies, monitor progress, and adjust plans to stay on track.</p> <li> <p>Proactively manage cross-functional risks and dependencies to drive continuous improvement and team alignment.</p> <li> <p>Monitor product performance and track key performance indicators (KPIs) to assess impact and adjust strategies accordingly.</p> <li> <p>Review completed development work to validate acceptance criteria, ensuring products meet expectations and deliver value.</p> <li> <p>Perform other duties as assigned by the supervisor.</p> </ul> <p><strong>Education:</strong><br> Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Information Systems, Business Management, or a related field. Equivalent practical experience will be considered.</p> <p><strong>Required Qualifications and Experience:</strong></p> <ul> <li> <p>Minimum of 5 years of experience as a Senior Product Manager.</p> <li> <p>Minimum of 3 years of product management experience for software products, preferably in B2B enterprise SaaS or Tax & Accounting domains (CPA firm experience a plus).</p> <li> <p>Proven hands-on experience with Agile Scrum methodologies in a Product Owner or Technical Product Manager capacity.</p> <li> <p>Strong understanding of the software development lifecycle, including backlog management, user story writing, and iterative development planning.</p> <li> <p>Demonstrated ability to work closely with UX and technical teams to design and refine products based on user research and testing.</p> </ul> <p><strong>Preferred Skills and Competencies:</strong></p> <ul> <li> <p><strong>Strategic Thinking & Influence:</strong> Ability to align stakeholders, manage competing priorities, and drive a cohesive product vision.</p> <li> <p><strong>Data-Driven Decision-Making:</strong> Skilled in leveraging data and customer insights to inform product strategy and decisions.</p> <li> <p><strong>Technical Fluency & Problem Solving:</strong> Capable of translating complex business requirements into clear, actionable development tasks.</p> <li> <p><strong>Agility & Adaptability:</strong> Comfortable working in a fast-paced, changing environment with the flexibility to shift priorities as needed.</p> </ul>

job.title: Senior SAP EWM consultant (32622)
job.description: <p>Myticas Consulting is actively seeking a senior <strong>SAP EWM Consultant</strong> to support a long-term transformation engagement for a major utility and energy client. This is a <strong>hybrid role</strong> requiring <strong>50–70% travel to Winnipeg</strong>. Candidates may be based anywhere in Canada but must be flexible with travel as needed.</p> <p>The consultant will play a <strong>key functional leadership role</strong> within the SAP EWM workstream and collaborate closely with stakeholders to design and implement warehouse and logistics solutions using SAP S/4HANA.</p> <p><strong>Responsibilities:</strong></p> <ul> <li> <p>Lead and deliver SAP Extended Warehouse Management (EWM) implementations</p> <li> <p>Configure warehouse structures (e.g., storage types, sections, activity areas)</p> <li> <p>Manage picking and putaway strategies, process/layout-oriented storage control</p> <li> <p>Integrate EWM with related SAP modules (TM, PP, MM, SD)</p> <li> <p>Execute blueprinting, document business requirements, and lead testing cycles</p> <li> <p>Provide expert client-facing communication and presentations</p> <li> <p>Mentor junior consultants and support stakeholder alignment across teams</p> </ul> <p><strong>Qualifications:</strong></p> <ul> <li> <p>5–8+ years of SAP EWM experience with at least 2 full lifecycle implementations</p> <li> <p>Strong hands-on configuration experience with SAP EWM</p> <li> <p>Experience integrating with SAP TM, PP, MM, and SD modules</p> <li> <p>Prior experience leading teams on SAP S/4HANA projects</p> <li> <p>Strong communication and presentation skills</p> <li> <p>Experience delivering solutions in the utility, energy, or related industries is a plus</p> <li> <p>Familiarity with SAP TM is an asset</p> </ul> <p><strong>Additional Information:</strong></p> <ul> <li> <p>Travel to Winnipeg required (50–70%)</p> <li> <p>Candidates must be located in Canada</p> </ul>

job.title: Cloud Operations Engineer (32574)
job.description: <p><strong>Job Title:</strong> Cloud Operations Engineer<br> <strong>Location:</strong> Vancouver, BC</p> <hr> <h3><strong>Qualifications Required</strong></h3> <ul> <li> <p>Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Cybersecurity, or a related field. Equivalent professional experience will also be considered.</p> <li> <p>A minimum of 7 years of experience in Azure cloud operations, with a strong focus on security and vulnerability management.</p> <li> <p>Proven experience in managing and securing large-scale Azure environments in production settings.</p> <li> <p>Hands-on experience with vulnerability scanning, remediation, and compliance within enterprise cloud infrastructures.</p> <li> <p>Extensive experience in security incident response and threat mitigation in Azure environments.</p> </ul> <hr> <h3><strong>Technical Skills</strong></h3> <p><strong>Azure Expertise</strong></p> <ul> <li> <p>Deep understanding of core Azure services, including:</p> <ul> <li> <p>Azure Security Center</p> <li> <p>Microsoft Defender for Cloud</p> <li> <p>Azure Key Vault</p> <li> <p>Azure Policy</p> <li> <p>Azure Sentinel (SIEM)</p> <li> <p>Azure Active Directory (Azure AD)</p> </ul> </ul> <p><strong>Security and Vulnerability Tools</strong></p> <ul> <li> <p>Proficient in using tools such as Qualys, Tenable Nessus, or Rapid7 for vulnerability scanning and management.</p> <li> <p>Experience with native Azure security tools for threat detection and remediation.</p> </ul> <p><strong>Infrastructure Hardening</strong></p> <ul> <li> <p>Strong knowledge of best practices for securing Azure resources such as virtual machines, storage accounts, Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS), and network components.</p> <li> <p>Familiarity with zero-trust architecture principles and their implementation in Azure.</p> </ul> <p><strong>Automation and Scripting</strong></p> <ul> <li> <p>Advanced scripting skills using PowerShell, Azure CLI, Python, or other automation tools.</p> <li> <p>Experience in integrating security checks and controls within CI/CD pipelines.</p> </ul> <hr> <h3><strong>Certifications (Preferred or Mandatory)</strong></h3> <p><strong>Azure Cloud Certifications</strong></p> <ul> <li> <p>Microsoft Certified: Azure Administrator Associate (AZ-104)</p> <li> <p>Microsoft Certified: Azure Security Engineer Associate (AZ-500)</p> <li> <p>Microsoft Certified: Cybersecurity Architect Expert (SC-100)</p> </ul> <p><strong>Security Certifications</strong></p> <ul> <li> <p>Certified Information Systems Security Professional (CISSP)</p> <li> <p>Certified Ethical Hacker (CEH)</p> <li> <p>CompTIA Security+</p> <li> <p>GIAC certifications (e.g., GCIH, GSEC, GCED)</p> </ul> <hr> <h3><strong>Other Requirements</strong></h3> <ul> <li> <p>Familiarity with regulatory and compliance standards such as ISO 27001, SOC 2, GDPR, and HIPAA.</p> <li> <p>Experience conducting or supporting cloud security audits.</p> <li> <p>Demonstrated ability to stay up to date with emerging cloud and cybersecurity technologies and trends.</p> </ul>

job.title: IT Director - PMO (32554)
job.description: <p><strong>Job Title:</strong> Director, IT (PMO)<br> <strong>Location:</strong> Ottawa – Hybrid (3 Days On-Site, Mandatory and Non-Negotiable)<br> <strong>Type:</strong> Full-Time, Permanent (8-Hour Workday)<br> <strong>Language Requirement:</strong> Bilingual Preferred (French/English)<br> <strong>Security Clearance:</strong> Must obtain clearance equivalent to Enhanced Reliability Status (Canada)<br> <strong>Eligibility:</strong> Must be a Canadian Citizen or Permanent Resident</p> <hr> <h3><strong>About the Role</strong></h3> <p>The Director of IT (PMO) is a strategic leadership position responsible for aligning IT initiatives with enterprise objectives and ensuring the successful delivery of high-impact technology projects. The Director will provide expert guidance, foster cross-functional collaboration, and oversee a portfolio of projects that deliver long-term organizational value.</p> <p>This role will lead the development and enforcement of a consistent IT project management framework, ensuring compliance with standardized methodologies and governance practices. The Director will also provide senior leadership with timely insights into project health, risk exposure, and emerging opportunities across the portfolio.</p> <hr> <h3><strong>Key Responsibilities</strong></h3> <p><strong>Strategic Portfolio Oversight</strong></p> <ul> <li> <p>Drive the evolution and adoption of the IT PMO framework to ensure alignment with organizational goals.</p> <li> <p>Manage the enterprise-wide IT project portfolio, prioritizing initiatives and optimizing resource allocation.</p> <li> <p>Advise executive stakeholders using data-driven insights to support strategic investment and resource planning.</p> </ul> <p><strong>Project Leadership and Governance</strong></p> <ul> <li> <p>Lead and mentor project managers and support staff to promote high performance and accountability.</p> <li> <p>Establish and enforce governance standards across all projects.</p> <li> <p>Proactively identify and manage risks, implementing mitigation strategies to ensure successful delivery.</p> </ul> <p><strong>Executive Collaboration</strong></p> <ul> <li> <p>Engage regularly with senior leadership to align on digital strategy, planning, and delivery progress.</p> <li> <p>Prepare and deliver executive-level reports and presentations that support informed decision-making.</p> <li> <p>Handle sensitive and confidential project data with integrity and discretion.</p> </ul> <p><strong>Risk Management</strong></p> <ul> <li> <p>Identify risks across individual projects and the broader portfolio, escalating critical issues as required.</p> <li> <p>Develop and implement contingency plans to ensure project continuity.</p> </ul> <p><strong>Process Optimization and Continuous Improvement</strong></p> <ul> <li> <p>Analyze project outcomes to identify areas for improvement and incorporate lessons learned.</p> <li> <p>Promote the use of modern tools and delivery methodologies, including Agile and hybrid approaches.</p> <li> <p>Continuously refine PMO structures and practices to enhance organizational effectiveness.</p> </ul> <p><strong>Reporting and Metrics</strong></p> <ul> <li> <p>Define and track key performance indicators (KPIs) for project and portfolio success.</p> <li> <p>Provide concise, data-driven reports and dashboards to executive stakeholders.</p> </ul> <p><strong>Project Execution</strong></p> <ul> <li> <p>Lead the end-to-end delivery of complex, high-impact IT projects, ensuring they are completed on time, within budget, and with strong stakeholder engagement.</p> </ul> <hr> <h3><strong>Qualifications and Experience</strong></h3> <p><strong>Education</strong></p> <ul> <li> <p>Post-secondary degree or diploma in Business Administration, Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field.</p> </ul> <p><strong>Experience</strong></p> <ul> <li> <p>Minimum of 8 years of progressive experience in IT project management.</p> <li> <p>At least 2 years in a leadership role managing a PMO or IT project portfolio.</p> </ul> <p><strong>Certifications</strong></p> <ul> <li> <p>Project Management Professional (PMP) certification is required.</p> </ul> <p><strong>Key Skills</strong></p> <ul> <li> <p>Demonstrated experience leading enterprise-wide IT projects and managing PMO teams.</p> <li> <p>Proven ability to work with C-suite executives and handle confidential information.</p> <li> <p>In-depth knowledge of project management methodologies, including Waterfall, Agile, and hybrid models.</p> <li> <p>Proficiency in tools such as Microsoft Project, Jira, and Smartsheet.</p> <li> <p>Strong interpersonal, analytical, and organizational skills.</p> <li> <p>Ability to manage multiple projects and competing priorities in a fast-paced environment.</p> </ul>

job.title: Technical Manager, Professional Services (32658)
job.description: <p>Our client is seeking a hands-on <strong>Technical Manager</strong> to lead the design, development, and delivery of custom technical solutions across their entire product suite. This role blends technical leadership with project execution, guiding engineers and workflow developers through the successful implementation of enterprise-grade media workflows, systems integrations, and cloud-based solutions.</p> <p>The ideal candidate will have deep technical expertise in cloud infrastructure, software integration, scripting, and solution architecture. They are passionate about translating customer needs into scalable, high-impact solutions while driving engineering excellence through mentorship, best practices, and cross-functional collaboration.</p> <hr> <h3><strong>Core Responsibilities</strong></h3> <ul> <li> <p>Translate customer requirements into actionable technical tasks.</p> <li> <p>Contribute to writing and reviewing Statements of Work (SOW) by providing technical task breakdowns and time estimates.</p> <li> <p>Collaborate with the Commercial Lead to align on project scope, milestones, and sprint planning.</p> <li> <p>Define technical architecture and approaches for workflow implementation.</p> <li> <p>Allocate technical resources and prioritize tasks based on sprint goals.</p> <li> <p>Work with Engineering and DevOps teams to ensure infrastructure, integration, and deployment requirements are met.</p> <li> <p>Review and approve code, enforcing coding standards and best practices.</p> <li> <p>Ensure all technical deliverables meet customer expectations and internal quality standards.</p> <li> <p>Promote best practices in software development and workflow automation.</p> <li> <p>Mentor engineers to foster professional growth and technical excellence.</p> <li> <p>Proactively identify opportunities to improve customer deployments by recommending complementary solutions.</p> <li> <p>Analyze existing customer setups to identify inefficiencies and propose optimizations using the broader product suite.</p> <li> <p>Serve as a technical advisor, helping customers align their needs with the capabilities of our client&apos;s platform.</p> </ul> <hr> <h3><strong>Required Qualifications and Skills</strong></h3> <ul> <li> <p>Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or a related field (or equivalent experience).</p> <li> <p>3+ years of experience in software development or solution engineering.</p> <li> <p>2+ years of experience in technical leadership or a senior engineering role.</p> <li> <p>Proficiency in object-oriented design, API development, scripting (e.g., Python, Bash), and cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP).</p> <li> <p>Familiarity with workflow automation tools and version control systems.</p> </ul>

job.title: Bilingual Salesforce Business Analyst – Grantmaking (32602)
job.description: <p>Our client, a leading financial institution, is seeking a skilled<strong> Bilingual</strong> <strong>Salesforce Business Analyst</strong> with hands-on experience in <strong>Salesforce Non-Profit Cloud and grantmaking processes</strong> to support a high-impact digital transformation initiative within their Banking Technology division.</p> <p>This role is ideal for a <strong>business-oriented professional</strong> who brings strong <strong>financial services experience</strong>, paired with <strong>Salesforce consulting expertise</strong>. The selected candidate will drive actionable insights and process improvements across Salesforce platforms, enabling smarter decision-making and operational efficiency.</p> <hr> <h3><strong>Responsibilities:</strong></h3> <ul> <li> <p>Collaborate with stakeholders to gather, document, and analyze business requirements.</p> <li> <p>Evaluate and streamline current business processes.</p> <li> <p>Create functional specifications, business cases, and support implementation efforts.</p> <li> <p>Generate reports, dashboards, and visualizations using Salesforce and data tools.</p> <li> <p>Facilitate stakeholder meetings and communicate findings effectively.</p> <li> <p>Support testing and project planning within Agile/Scrum environments.</p> <li> <p>Ensure alignment with business goals, compliance, and technology best practices.</p> </ul> <hr> <h3><strong>Required Qualifications:</strong></h3> <ul> <li> <p><strong>Mandatory:</strong> Experience with <strong>Salesforce Non-Profit Cloud</strong> and grantmaking workflows.</p> <li> <p>Minimum <strong>3+ years</strong> of experience as a Business Analyst in the <strong>financial services industry</strong>.</p> <li> <p><strong>2+ years</strong> of experience in a <strong>consulting environment</strong>.</p> <li> <p>Strong analytical skills; experience with <strong>Excel, SQL, Power BI/Tableau</strong>, and project tools.</p> <li> <p>Experience with multiple Salesforce clouds, including:</p> <ul> </ul> <li> <p><strong>Sales Cloud</strong></p> <li> <p><strong>Service Cloud</strong></p> <li> <p><strong>Experience Cloud</strong></p> <li> <p><strong>Financial Services Cloud</strong></p> </ul> <ul> <li> <p>Exceptional BILINGUAL communication and stakeholder engagement skills. (FRENCH)</p> <li> <p>Familiarity with Agile/Scrum methodology.</p> </ul>

You will design, develop, and implement efficient, automated workflows across a variety of platforms and applications, ensuring smooth integration, optimized performance, and high customer satisfaction.</p> <p><strong>Essential Functions</strong></p> <ul> <li>Design and implement automated workflows tailored to customer requirements. <li>Develop and deliver reliable, scalable solutions job.title: D365 trainer with SharePoint experience (32662)
job.description: <p>Our client is seeking a highly experienced <strong>D365 Trainer with SharePoint expertise</strong> to support a national training and information management initiative. The ideal candidate will have a deep understanding of Microsoft 365 (D365), SharePoint (on-premise and online), and experience in developing training programs, videos, and instructional content for users across varied departments and time zones.<br> <u><strong>Mandatory Active SECRET clearance</strong></u></p> <hr> <h3><strong>Key Responsibilities:</strong></h3> <ul> <li> <p>Develop and deliver <strong>training videos</strong> and <strong>step-by-step guides</strong> for users on SharePoint (on-premise) and Defence 365 features.</p> <li> <p>Build and maintain a <strong>SharePoint Online Training site</strong> with how-to content, videos, and best practices.</p> <li> <p>Conduct training sessions for <strong>new Site Owners</strong> using training packages and sandbox environments.</p> <li> <p>Collaborate with the Communications (CO) and Information Management (IM) teams to design onboarding/orientation training for new team members.</p> <li> <p>Design and deploy <strong>Power Apps</strong> for automating team member intake forms and leadership processes.</p> <li> <p>Create an internal <strong>Wiki</strong> with approval workflows to replace DWAN-only resources on D365.</p> <li> <p>Support users in navigating the Microsoft Tenant environment post-launch.</p> <li> <p>Perform <strong>daily web administration</strong> for over 1,200 SharePoint sites.</p> <li> <p>Lead <strong>biweekly Information Management Working Groups</strong> and L1/L2 sessions to distribute updates and training.</p> <li> <p>Host <strong>monthly deployed Information Management sessions</strong> for field IMOs.</p> </ul> <hr> <h3><strong>Qualifications:</strong></h3> <ul> <li> <p>Proven expertise in <strong>D365</strong> and <strong>SharePoint (Online & On-Premise)</strong></p> <li> <p>Experience in instructional design and e-learning/training video creation</p> <li> <p>Strong experience with Power Apps and workflow automation</p> <li> <p>Comfortable presenting to and training users of varying technical skill levels</p> <li> <p>Ability to manage and administer large-scale SharePoint environments</p> <li> <p>Active <strong>SECRET clearance</strong> required</p> </ul>

job.title: SAP Functional Lead – Project Systems - PS (32621)
job.description: <p>Myticas Consulting is looking for a senior <strong>SAP Functional Lead – Project Systems (PS)</strong> for a long-term HYBRID (Winnipeg) consulting engagement with a major utility and energy client. The successful candidate will be responsible for leading the design and implementation of SAP Project Systems solutions, ensuring alignment with business needs across project lifecycle management, finance integration, and operational workflows.</p> <p>This is a high-visibility role requiring strong leadership, communication, and problem-solving skills. The position is hybrid with 50–70% travel to Winnipeg, MB. Candidates must be flexible with on-site travel and able to engage with stakeholders at all levels, including executives.</p> <p><strong>Key Responsibilities:</strong></p> <ul> <li> <p>Lead the configuration and implementation of SAP PS solutions, including integration with maintenance, service, and finance modules</p> <li> <p>Collaborate with business and technical teams to gather and translate business requirements</p> <li> <p>Drive client discussions, challenging stakeholders when needed to ensure alignment with SAP best practices</p> <li> <p>Participate in project blueprinting, documentation, and testing activities</p> <li> <p>Support change management, training, and go-live planning</p> <li> <p>Monitor project progress, manage risks, and communicate outcomes effectively</p> </ul> <p><strong>Required Qualifications:</strong></p> <ul> <li> <p>Minimum 5 years (preferably 8+) SAP PS and/or PPM experience</p> <li> <p>Experience in at least 2–3 full lifecycle SAP implementations</p> <li> <p>Prior consulting experience with strong client-facing communication skills</p> <li> <p>Background in utilities, energy, oil, or gas is a strong asset</p> <li> <p>Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Finance, or a related field</p> <li> <p>SAP certifications highly preferred</p> </ul>

job.title: Senior Business & Program Management Consultant (32660)
job.description: <strong>Senior Business & Program Management Consultant (GxP/Clinical)</strong><br> <strong>Location:</strong> Waukegan, IL (3 days onsite)<br> <strong>Company:</strong> Myticas's direct client based in North Chicago, IL<br> <br> <u><strong>MUST Have:</strong></u> <ol> <li>8-10 years of Senior IT project experience: System Lifecycle (SLC) Expertise. <li><strong>GXP system</strong> experience required - GXP system implementation including custom development and validated systems. <li>Portfolio / <strong>Program management experience.</strong> <li><strong>Clinical Systems</strong> <li>Project financial management, and vendor management expertise. </ol> <br> <strong>Description:</strong><br> Senior Business Management Consultant to manage and drive all aspects of TWO in-flight system development (custom build) and enhancement projects, complete contracting / pre-SLC assessments for new projects, and assess new business capability requests.<br> <br> <strong>Required:</strong> <ul> <li>8-10 years of Senior IT project experience: System Lifecycle (SLC) Expertise, Portfolio / Program management experience, project financial management expertise, vendor management expertise. <li>Must have the ability to create / review SLC documents <li>Track record of successful GXP system implementation including custom development and validated systems. <li>GXP system experience required, <li>Clinical experience strongly preferred <li>Methodology used: Waterfall and Agile </ul>
