job.title: Product Line Manager - CIP (32607)
job.description: <p>The recruitment team at Myticas Consulting is currently seeking an experienced Optical Networking resource who would be interested in working within the CIP vertical. </p> <p>We are looking for a candidate who is currently based in Canada since this is offered on a remote full-time permanent basis and requires the resource to be located within the country.</p> <p>The candidate in this role should have the following requirements:</p> <ul> <li>Highly experienced in CIP Optical Networking Deployment <li>Over 8 Years of Optical Networking expertise <li>Experience with Optical Network deployment and system development <li>Experience with Optical PLM <li>Experience with Operational Support Systems <li>Experience with Open Standards and Concepts </ul>

job.title: Employment Equity Resource - Federal Job Evaluation & Pay Equity Compliance (34080)
job.description: <p>Our client, a leading federal agency, is seeking an <strong>Employment Equity Resource</strong> to support a new project related to federal job evaluation and pay equity compliance. This is a <strong>confirmed contract win</strong> and we are looking to move quickly to identify a qualified consultant. Must have Enhanced Security clearance in place. On-Site.</p> <p><strong>Key Responsibilities:</strong></p> <ul> <li> <p>Develop and support job evaluation plans and frameworks to ensure compliance with <strong>Federal Pay Equity legislation</strong></p> <li> <p>Collaborate with pay equity committees and union members to facilitate job evaluation and classification discussions</p> <li> <p>Conduct advanced data analysis on compensation and job structure data</p> <li> <p>Create clear and concise reports and presentations for internal and external stakeholders</p> </ul> <p><strong>Required Skills & Experience:</strong></p> <ul> <li> <p>Experience supporting <strong>federal pay equity compliance and job evaluation</strong> projects</p> <li> <p>Familiarity working with <strong>pay equity committees and/or union groups</strong></p> <li> <p>Strong analytical skills, with a mix of <strong>qualitative and quantitative analysis</strong></p> <li> <p>Proficient in <strong>Microsoft Excel</strong> (advanced formulas, functions, and interconnected worksheets)</p> <li> <p>Experienced in analyzing <strong>large, complex data sets</strong></p> <li> <p>Ability to develop polished presentations using <strong>Microsoft PowerPoint</strong></p> </ul> <p><strong>Nice to Have:</strong></p> <ul> <li> <p>Previous work within <strong>federal government</strong> job classification systems</p> <li> <p>Bilingual (English/French)</p> </ul>

job.title: EDW Informatica ETL Developer (32541)
job.description: <p><strong>EDW Informatica ETL Developer </strong></p> <p><strong>Job Title: </strong>Enterprise Data Warehouse (EDW) Informatica ETL Developer</p> <p><strong>Duration: </strong>12 months with possible multi-year extension/s</p> <p><strong>Job Summary: </strong></p> <p>Clover Consulting (a Myticas Co.) is are seeking a highly experienced Informatica Extract Transform Load (ETL) Developer for a large, direct client in Springfield, IL. This opportunity will be an assent to the Enterprise Data Warehouse (EDW) team.</p> <p>This role is responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining robust ETL processes using Informatica PowerCenter and Teradata. The ideal candidate will have a deep understanding of data integration, performance tuning, and data warehousing best practices, with a focus on supporting healthcare-related data systems.</p> <p><strong>Key Responsibilities: </strong></p> <ul> <li>Design and implement ETL solutions using Informatica PowerCenter to extract, transform, and load data from various agency sources. <li>Automate data staging processes and optimize ETL job scheduling for performance and efficiency. <li>Administer and support ETL environments, including development and production systems. <li>Perform repository backups, recovery operations, and system maintenance. <li>Develop mappings, mapplets, sessions, and workflows using a wide range of Informatica transformations. <li>Monitor and troubleshoot ETL jobs across development, testing, and production environments. <li>Write and optimize complex SQL queries and Unix Shell scripts for data marts and interfaces in Teradata. <li>Collaborate with stakeholders to define requirements, document technical solutions, and support project planning. <li>Participate in unit, integration, and system testing. <li>Provide technical support, mentoring, and guidance to team members. <li>Communicate project status and deliverables to leadership and clients. <li>Continuously learn and apply new technologies to enhance system performance and capabilities. </ul> <p><strong>Required Qualifications:</strong></p> <ul> <li>7+ years of experience with Informatica PowerCenter and ETL development. <li>5+ years of experience writing complex SQL and performance tuning. <li>5+ years of experience with Teradata (v17+), including Fastload, TPT, and Multiload utilities. <li>5+ years of Informatica PowerCenter administration experience. <li>2+ years of Unix Shell (Bash/Korn) scripting experience. <li>Strong communication, collaboration, and mentoring skills. <li>Bachelor’s or advanced degree in IT, Computer Science, Mathematics, or a related field. <li>Strong organizational and time management skills. 2025 Page 1 of 2 Enterprise Data Warehouse (EDW) ETL/Informatica Developer </ul> <p><strong>Preferred Qualifications: </strong></p> <ul> <li>Residing in or near Springfield, IL. <li>5+ years of data warehouse development experience. <li>5+ years of data modeling experience using ERWIN or similar tools. <li>2+ years of experience with Azure Data Factory and Snowflake. <li>Experience with scripting languages such as Python, R, or JavaScript (React). <li>Familiarity with Informatica Data Quality (IDQ), Address Doctor, and Metadata Manager. <li>Experience with Medicaid, Medicare, or healthcare data systems. <li>Experience working in Agile environments. <li>Knowledge of BI and data integration technologies across relational and multidimensional systems. </ul>

job.title: Software Architect – System Model Application (32513)
job.description: <p><strong>Job Description: Software Architect – System Model Application</strong></p> <p>Our Software Development team architects, develops, tests, and maintains a state-of-the-art engineering software tool that runs on high-performance computing (HPC) infrastructure. This application is designed to model resource allocation and end-to-end communication system performance for a next-generation satellite constellation.</p> <p>As a <strong>Software Architect</strong>, the selected candidate will play a key leadership role in the software’s development, productization, and ongoing maintenance. This position provides critical day-to-day technical direction to team members, fostering a cohesive and productive development environment. The Software Architect will also collaborate with cross-functional engineering teams to ensure seamless integration and alignment with organizational goals.</p> <hr> <h3><strong>Main Responsibilities</strong></h3> <ul> <li> <p>Lead the design, development, and deployment of the System Model suite, enhancing its readiness as a production-grade engine for operational business applications running in HPC environments—both cloud-based and on-premise.</p> <li> <p>Provide technical leadership, mentorship, and support to the development team, encouraging innovation and collaboration.</p> <li> <p>Develop and propose solutions to complex technical challenges, including recommendations on software architecture and technology stacks.</p> <li> <p>Collaborate with system engineers, product owners, and testing teams to gather requirements and deliver robust software solutions.</p> <li> <p>Produce clear technical documentation for internal stakeholders and external collaborators.</p> </ul> <hr> <h3><strong>Education and Experience Required</strong></h3> <ul> <li> <p>Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field.</p> <li> <p>Extensive hands-on experience in software development.</p> <li> <p>Prior experience in a technical leadership or architecture role.</p> <li> <p>Proficiency in programming languages including C/C++, Golang, Java, Python, SQL, and Bash.</p> <li> <p>Experience with tools and technologies such as Kubernetes (including Helm charts), Terraform, Packer, Ansible, containerization, and secret management (e.g., Azure Key Vault, HashiCorp Vault).</p> <li> <p>Familiarity with Azure Cloud services, including fundamentals, IAM, and networking.</p> <li> <p>Experience with Matlab and related best practices is an asset.</p> <li> <p>Comfortable working within Agile development environments.</p> <li> <p>Experience with cluster job managers.</p> <li> <p>Background in satellite or communication systems is beneficial but not required.</p> <li> <p>10+ years of professional experience in software development or system architecture.</p> </ul> <hr> <h3><strong>Additional Skills and Abilities</strong></h3> <ul> <li> <p>Strong problem-solving skills with meticulous attention to detail.</p> <li> <p>Collaborative team player who fosters a positive, innovative team environment.</p> <li> <p>Excellent verbal and written communication skills.</p> <li> <p>Proven ability to effectively engage with stakeholders, engineering teams, and partners.</p> <li> <p>Solid understanding of the business context and constraints of software system design and deployment.</p> <li> <p>Ability to manage competing priorities and project demands.</p> <li> <p>Passion for learning and working with complex systems and technologies.</p> <li> <p>Fluency in English (written and spoken); French is an asset.</p> </ul>

job.title: D365 Finance Configuration Consultant (32537)
job.description: <p>Our client is in the build stage of a D365 Finance & Operations and Commerce implementation for a retail organization based in New Brunswick. The go-live is targeted for August 2026.</p> <p><strong>Role Overview:</strong><br> We are seeking an experienced <strong>Finance Configuration Consultant</strong> with deep expertise in <strong>Microsoft D365 F&O</strong>. The ideal candidate will lead client-facing design sessions, provide hands-on system configuration, and support testing initiatives across the Finance workstreams.</p> <p><strong>Key Responsibilities:</strong></p> <ul> <li> <p>Facilitate and lead finance-related design workshops</p> <li> <p>Configure the D365 F&O system to meet business requirements</p> <li> <p>Support client-side testing and validation activities</p> <li> <p>Collaborate with business stakeholders and technical teams</p> <li> <p>Provide input and expertise on best practices for D365 Finance implementations</p> </ul> <p><strong>Qualifications:</strong></p> <ul> <li> <p>Minimum 10 years of experience in Microsoft D365 Finance</p> <li> <p>Hands-on configuration experience across core finance modules</p> <li> <p>Strong communication and client engagement skills</p> <li> <p>Microsoft certification in D365 Finance (asset)</p> <li> <p>Experience in retail or public sector projects (asset)</p> </ul>

job.title: Technical Support and Customer Service Associate (32581)
job.description: <strong>Technical Support and Customer Service Associate </strong><strong>- REMOTE<br> <br> Contract: 12 months with possible CTH</strong><br> <strong>Schedule: 3rd shift - 12 am to 9 am, Tuesday thru Saturday<br> Work Type: Fully Remote</strong><br> <br> Myticas is actively seeking a <strong>Technical Support and </strong><strong>Customer Service Associate </strong>for a direct client to join their <strong>Personal Support Center (PSC)</strong> team. This role is perfect for someone with a passion for helping others, a knack for troubleshooting, and the ability to thrive in a fast-paced, tech-forward environment.<br> <br> As a PSC Associate, you’ll be the first point of contact for users via phone, email, and chat—working to resolve technical issues, answer questions, and ensure a seamless customer experience. You'll be supported by extensive training, a detailed knowledge base, and a collaborative team ready to help you grow.<br> <br> <strong>What You’ll Do:</strong> <ul> <li>Provide Tier 1 technical support for software, hardware, and connectivity issues <li>Assist with password resets, software installations, VPN setups, and general troubleshooting <li>Escalate complex issues to senior team members when needed <li>Maintain clear, professional communication across all customer interactions <li>Simultaneously manage support requests via phone, email, and chat <li>Accurately log cases using tools like ServiceNow and Zendesk </ul> <strong>What We’re Looking For:</strong> <ul> <li>Strong customer service and communication skills <li>Comfort working in a flexible, 24/7/365 support environment <li>Ability to adapt to new tools, systems, and processes quickly <li>Team player who’s open to ongoing feedback, learning, and development </ul> <strong>Why Join Us:</strong> <ul> <li>Hands-on training and mentoring <li>Access to a robust internal knowledge base <li>Opportunities to collaborate with tech experts and leadership <li>A supportive team environment where growth is encouraged </ul> If you're ready to jump into a dynamic support role where no two days are the same, apply now or reach out to learn more. We’re excited to meet you!

job.title: Digital Content Specialist (32576)
job.description: <p><strong>Job Title: Digital Content Specialist</strong><br> <strong>Location:</strong> On-Site – Grand Rapids, MI<br> <strong>Contract Duration:</strong> 6+ Months (Extensions Likely)<br> <strong>Company:</strong> Clover Consulting (a Myticas Company)<br> <strong>Client:</strong> Direct Client in Grand Rapids, MI<br> <strong>Note:</strong> Local candidates preferred. This role is not eligible for sponsorship.</p> <p><strong>Job Overview:</strong><br> Clover Consulting is seeking a <strong>Digital Content Specialist</strong> to support our client’s marketing efforts in Grand Rapids, MI. This is a full-time, on-site contract opportunity with a strong possibility of extension. The successful candidate will assist in the development and execution of CRM campaigns using a newly implemented customer 360 database and marketing automation platform.</p> <p><strong>About the Team:</strong><br> The North American CRM team designs and implements marketing strategies that leverage automation software to enhance lead generation, sales, retention, productivity, and customer loyalty—particularly focused on Independent Business Owners (IBOs) and consumers.</p> <p><strong>Role Summary:</strong><br> As a Digital Content Specialist, you will be responsible for supporting the planning, development, deployment, and analysis of CRM campaigns. These communications target IBOs, customers, or a combination of both. Your primary responsibility is to ensure all campaigns are executed accurately and on schedule.</p> <p><strong>Key Responsibilities:</strong></p> <ul> <li>Serve as the main liaison between internal stakeholders, external agencies, and the CRM production team. <li>Manage CRM campaign deliverables, including planning, timelines, risk management, and resource allocation. <li>Submit use cases and other documentation for internal review and approval. <li>Schedule creative briefings and manage content development updates. <li>Route creative materials, compile proof comments, and finalize HTML content for translation. <li>Conduct thorough quality assurance checks on email content in all supported languages and markets (including verification of links, artwork, and videos). <li>Educate stakeholders on the capabilities of the CRM platform. <li>Track campaign progress and update timelines and work estimates as needed. <li>Distribute final CRM creative assets to internal stakeholders for reference. <li>Provide on-call support for end-of-month and urgent field email communications, per established protocols. <li>Serve as a backup to the Email Coordinator. </ul> <p><strong>Required Qualifications:</strong></p> <ul> <li>Associate&apos;s or Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Communications, or a related field; equivalent certifications will also be considered. <li>Minimum of 2 years of experience in Communications, Marketing, or a related discipline. <li>Basic knowledge of CRM platforms. <li>Ability to independently resolve routine issues. <li>Capable of performing assigned tasks and supporting projects under supervision. </ul> <p><strong>Preferred Skills and Attributes:</strong></p> <ul> <li>Strong passion for marketing and delivering a top-tier user experience to engage both customers and IBOs. <li>Solid understanding of email marketing strategies, triggered campaigns, and A/B testing to optimize business performance. <li>Proven ability to collaborate effectively with internal teams and external vendors. <li>Excellent verbal and written communication skills. <li>Strong organizational skills with the ability to manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment. <li>Flexible and able to perform well under pressure and tight deadlines. <li>Critical thinking, problem-solving, and follow-through skills. <li>High level of professionalism and attention to detail. <li>Ability to work independently and as part of a team. <li>Willingness and ability to work on-site at the client location in Grand Rapids, MI. </ul>

job.title: Manufacturing Engineer (32643)
job.description: Clover Consulting (a Myticas Co.) has a direct client in Grand Rapids, MI in need of a MANUFACTURING ENGINEER - willing to consider all experience levels - this is a contract role to start, with conversion to perm the goal. <br> <br> <br> Planned 2nd shift hours of 4pm-12pm/1am, to support production.<br> <br> We are hiring Associate to Sr. Manufacturing Engineer to lead and provide ongoing support through our manufacturing life cycle!<br> <br> What You Will Be Doing:<br> With general direction, will lead the introduction of new products into the facility, improve productivity and profitability of existing production procedures, and provide ongoing support through the manufacturing life cycle. Acts as a technical expert in process technology<br> <br> <em>Improvements:</em> Independently, with innovation and creativity, evaluates manufacturing processes to ensure optimal labor and material costs to increase productivity and profitability. Through justifications and evaluations, identifies prime areas for improvement. Tracks expenditures to ensure outlays are within budgeted amounts. Identifies, reduces, and eliminates worker exposure(s) to ergonomic stress(es) in the work place.<br> <br> <em>Floor Support</em>: Provides timely product and process support for any manufacturing area to diagnose problems and implement solutions to minimize interruptions to production.<br> <br> <em>Special Projects</em>: Leads the implementation of significant product, process, or other corporate change initiatives being introduced into the plant.<br> <br> <em>Strategic/Manufacturing Planning:</em> Provides advanced research to introduce/integrate new processes, equipment, and technologies into the company<br> <br> <br> Who You Are:<br> Preferred Skills and Competencies <ul> <li>Very strong analysis skills: process, capacity, cost/benefit, waste stream, and quality tools. <li>Internal and external quality support/management <li>Knowledge in lean manufacturing techniques: flow, PQ, equipment reliability, and set up reduction. <li>Facilitation and negotiation skills <li>Knowledge of material handling <li>Productivity improvement techniques: RCI’s <li>Behavior sciences (logic, sociology, etc.) <li>Economics and financial analysis <li>Work measurement <li>Interpersonal skills <li>Computer skills; advanced level required to utilize Excel and Access programs <li>Experience in design, specification, purchase, and installation of new equipment <li>Experience in the Engineering Design Process <li>Knowledge of simulation, process modeling, and value stream mapping <li>Project management and leadership ability <li>Occupational Bio Mechanics/Human Factors Engineering <li>Strategic planning </ul> <br> Required Skills and Competencies <ul> <li>4 year technical degree or equivalent education </ul> <br>

job.title: Digital Marketing Consultant (32563)
job.description: Clover Consulting has a direct client in Grand Rapids, MI in need of a Digital Marketing Consulting to support Search Engine Optimization activities. This is an ON-SITE role starting as a 5 months contract, with likely extensions. Candidates local to the Grand Rapids area, are preferred. Qualified candidates please provide resume. Thank you!<br> <table id="Master_PageContentPlaceHolder_screen_selectedTab_beelineForm_generalSection_Body"> <tbody> <tr id="Master_PageContentPlaceHolder_screen_selectedTab_beelineForm_jobDescriptionTextRow"> <th id="Master_PageContentPlaceHolder_screen_selectedTab_beelineForm_jobDescriptionTextLabel">Job Description (Visible to Supplier):</th> <td>Digital Marketing Contractor – Job Responsibilities<br> <br> In response to evolving digital marketing priorities and the growing importance of AI in search, we are expanding the role of our current SEO lead and seeking a Digital Marketing Contractor to provide support for core SEO responsibilities. This role will help ensure continuity in execution and performance monitoring while allowing the team to focus on broader strategic initiatives. The contractor will support global SEO operations and partner with market teams to enhance visibility, discoverability, and performance across digital properties.<br> <br> Duration: July – December 2025, with potential extension<br> Location: Grand Rapids, MI (Onsite)<br> Reports to: Global SEO Lead<br> <br> Key Responsibilities<br> <br> Operational SEO Execution<br> • Conduct keyword research to support market-level needs and content planning.<br> • Perform technical SEO audits using tools like Ahrefs and Google Search Console.<br> • Support content optimization efforts, including metadata, on-page structure, and internal linking.<br> • Compile and deliver monthly SEO performance reports using platforms such as Ahrefs, Heap, and GSC.<br> • Troubleshoot SEO issues reported by markets and provide actionable solutions.<br> • Leverage AI tools and approaches to generate recommendations for content optimization, keyword discovery, link-building, and landing page refinement.<br> • Integrate AI-enabled tools to automate repetitive SEO tasks and improve execution speed and scalability.<br> <br> SEO Training and Enablement<br> • Assist in delivering SEO onboarding sessions and office hours for market teams.<br> • Help maintain and update SEO playbooks, best practices, and documentation on SharePoint.<br> • Create or revise modular self-serve resources to enable independent market optimization.<br> • Support the creation and management of a centralized SharePoint hub for training.<br> <br> Performance Monitoring and Insights<br> • Support organic search sentiment analysis and reputation tracking.<br> • Monitor and extract insights from dashboards (Heap, Ahrefs) to identify trends and risks.<br> • Assist in evaluating SEO impact for major product launches and post-launch performance reviews.<br> • Apply AI-powered tools to surface deeper insights from large-scale performance data.<br> <br> Collaboration and Coordination<br> • Work cross-functionally with content, analytics, and technical teams to integrate SEO best practices.<br> • Participate in global team meetings or planning sessions to ensure SEO considerations are included.<br> • Escalate technical SEO issues or strategic risks to the Global SEO Lead.<br> <br> Tool and Vendor Support<br> • Assist with user access management, licensing coordination, and onboarding for SEO tools.<br> • Support evaluations of SEO tool usage and effectiveness.<br> • Coordinate with vendors to troubleshoot issues or implement platform improvements.<br> <br> ?<br> <br> Qualifications<br> • 5+ years of experience in digital marketing and hands-on SEO in global or multi-market settings.<br> • Proficiency with SEO tools like Heap, Ahrefs, Google Search Console, and Lumar (or equivalent).<br> • Strong analytical skills; able to turn performance data into clear, actionable insights.<br> • Excellent writing and editing skills, with an understanding of search-optimized content.<br> • Demonstrated experience creating or reviewing metadata, headers, and on-page copy for SEO.<br> • Familiarity with CMS platforms and technical SEO concepts (indexing, crawling, Core Web Vitals).<br> • Strong understanding of how AI can be applied to SEO (e.g., prompt engineering, content summarization, automated content audits, keyword clustering).<br> • Experience working with cross-functional teams across content, marketing, and tech.<br> • Ability to work independently, manage multiple priorities, and adapt in a fast-paced environment.<br> </td> </tr> </tbody> </table>

job.title: Ambulatory Clinical Informatics Analyst - Oracle Health/Cerner (32649)

experience in a health-related field.</p> <li> <p>2+ years in Clinical Informatics or supporting large-scale CIS implementations (Oracle Health/Cerner strongly preferred).</p> <li> <p>Deep understanding of ambulatory/medicine clinic workflows and interdisciplinary coordination.</p> <li> <p>Familiarity with healthcare terminology, CIS systems, and clinical transformation projects.</p> <li> <p>Ability to influence and collaborate with a range of stakeholders.</p> <li> <p>Excellent communication and documentation skills.</p> <li> <p>Strong problem-solving and process analysis job.title: Senior Manager, Radio System Engineering (32647)
job.description: <p>As the Senior Manager of Radio System Engineering, you will lead all technical aspects of radio system architecture, including air interface definition, concept of operations, functional specifications, and physical implementation of RF functions.</p> <hr> <p><strong>Main Responsibilities:</strong></p> <ul> <li> <p>Provide expert-level leadership in RF system development, including trade-offs involving ACP, PAR, out-of-band emissions, pass-band ripple, group delay, and more.</p> <li> <p>Support the finalization of radio system implementation involving agile multi-beam phased array antennas and beam hopping technology.</p> <li> <p>Define operational concepts for all phases of the system lifecycle such as user terminal commissioning, network entry, satellite handovers, time synchronization, and adaptive coding and modulation (ACM).</p> <li> <p>Act as the principal architect for defining air interfaces between user terminals, ground infrastructure, and satellite payloads.</p> <li> <p>Collaborate with RF, antenna, system, and terminal engineers to partition functionality between hardware and software components.</p> <li> <p>Provide input to the system modeling team on design assumptions and strategies for modeling link performance, accounting for impairments across system components.</p> <li> <p>Work closely with the Verification and Test team to ensure thorough validation of requirements and system performance.</p> <li> <p>Participate in relevant industry standards forums (e.g., DVB) and provide strategic recommendations to align internal systems with evolving standards.</p> </ul> <hr> <p><strong>Education & Experience – Required:</strong></p> <ul> <li> <p>Bachelor’s degree in Electrical, Computer, or Systems Engineering.</p> <li> <p>15+ years of experience in RF communications systems and/or RF equipment development.</p> <li> <p>Demonstrated experience taking RF systems from concept through iterative design, specification development, and low-rate production.</p> <li> <p>Strong background in system architecture, requirements management, and performance assessment for communication systems.</p> </ul> <hr> <p><strong>Education & Experience – Assets:</strong></p> <ul> <li> <p>Familiarity with DVB standards such as DVB-S2X and DVB-RCS2.</p> <li> <p>Solid understanding of digital communications, spread spectrum techniques, single and multi-carrier modulation (e.g., PSK, APSK, QAM).</p> <li> <p>Proficiency in MATLAB or equivalent tools for modeling and analyzing RF communication systems.</p> <li> <p>Deep knowledge of RF passive and active components and microwave frequency performance, including the effects of environmental factors such as rain fade.</p> <li> <p>Strong foundation in RF transceiver architecture and digital communication theory.</p> <li> <p>Excellent communication skills, with the ability to effectively engage stakeholders across engineering, management, and external partners.</p> <li> <p>Collaborative, adaptable, and capable of leading multidisciplinary teams in high-performance environments.</p> </ul>

job.title: Internal Audit Consultant – Banking Sector (34083)
job.description: <p>Our client is seeking <strong>three experienced Internal Audit Consultants</strong> to support the execution of a high-impact internal audit within the banking sector. The ideal candidates will bring strong expertise in internal audit practices, with a background in banking. Familiarity with <strong>Derivatives, Capital Market products, or Counterparty Credit Risk</strong> is considered a strong asset.</p> <p><strong>Responsibilities:</strong></p> <ul> <li> <p>Lead and support internal audit planning and execution</p> <li> <p>Conduct walkthrough meetings with business stakeholders</p> <li> <p>Perform control testing and validate audit evidence</p> <li> <p>Draft internal audit reports with observations and actionable recommendations</p> <li> <p>Collaborate with audit teams to ensure accurate and timely delivery</p> </ul> <p><strong>Required Skills & Experience:</strong></p> <ul> <li> <p>5+ years of Internal Audit and banking experience (mandatory)</p> <li> <p>Strong knowledge of financial controls, audit methodology, and risk management</p> <li> <p>Familiarity with <strong>Derivatives, Capital Markets, or Credit Risk</strong> (nice to have)</p> <li> <p>Excellent analytical, communication, and reporting skills</p> </ul> <p><strong>Rank:</strong> Senior Consultant</p> <p><strong>Work Model:</strong> Hybrid – Toronto-based, 2–3 days onsite per week preferred</p>
